characters: THEY PLUMMET ON THE ROPE TOWARDS THE BOTTOMLESS GORGE
ON A CRY OF PAIN WE CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A medieval PERSIAN ARMY camped on a forbidding mountain slope, twelve thousand feet high. A group of battle-scarred SOLDIERS cluster around a pair men playing DICE, kibitzing and making side bets. A heap of trinkets and coins is piled on the ground. One the GAMBLERS is a big BRUTE with rotted and missing teeth produces a golden bangle and drops it in the pot. All eye turn to his opponent...

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN,
dialogues.text: Who sits calmly with his back to us. We haven’t seen his face yet but his very stillness sets him apart. He’s as grimy and battle-worn as the rest but his armor and dress of higher quality. Dastan unfastens his own studded-leather wrist guard. Displays it for all to see; drops it on the pile. The men crane eagerly as Dastan rolls.. THREE: a bad roll The BRUTISH SOLDIER leers and scoops up the dice. CLOSE ON HIS HANDS as he secretly swaps the dice before rolling... A TWELVE! Groans from the crowd as the Brutish Soldier ra in his winnings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Kismet smiles upon me again.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I can think of other explanations... The Brutish Soldier looks up. Reveal Dastan’s face: Early 20s with the slim bearing of a natural athlete, he’ a nobler stamp than this gang of common soldiers yet completely at ease in their midst.

dialogues.speaker: BRUTISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Careful friend. Nobody likes a sore loser.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I’m not a sore loser. I just don’t like being cheated. The other soldiers fall silent. Uh oh. The Brutish Soldier glares at Dastan and shrugs off his cloak. Massive chest and arms. He stands.

dialogues.speaker: BRUTISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Let’s see how you like a beating then... Then he stops short because: THE POINT OF DASTAN’S DAGGER is an inch away from his fac We barely saw Dastan pull it out -- he’s that quick.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I have a better suggestion: one more wager. Everything you’ve won against this... Dastan removes the dagger from the man’s face and flips i catching it by the blade. He offers the jeweled handle to the Brutish Soldier. It looks valuable...

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Those are real emeralds.

dialogues.speaker: BRUTISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: (examines it warily) A roll of the dice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, a test of skill-- I’1l take a single throw of the knife from fifteen paces. The Brutish Soldier raises an eyebrow. Fifteen paces is a long throw... he nods acceptance.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: An “X” is MARKED on a WOOD POST with a piece of charcoal. The Brutish Soldier counts out fifteen generous paces and draws a line in the dirt with his boot. Dastan steps up. He flips the dagger in his hand several times, concentrating like a pitcher on the mound. All eyes are on him. Various soldiers call out encouragement: take your time, don’t rush, etc... Dastan takes aim, cocks his arm and...

dialogues.speaker: HERALD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Prince Dastan! «throws! The dagger sails off target and.. KA-THUNK stick a wooden barrel. A HERALD arrives at a breathless gallop.

dialogues.speaker: HERALD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Prince Dastan, your brothers summon you. The soldiers look around, uncertain who he is talking to. Slowly it dawns on them that he’s addressing Dastan.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: All right. I’m on my way. The Brutish Soldier’s face is suddenly filled with fear. pulls the dagger free and hurries to return it to Dastan, going down on one knee...

dialogues.speaker: BRUTISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: My Lord... I-I had no idea.. please forgive me...

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: A bet’s a bet. Keep it. The Herald offers his horse and Dastan swings himself in the saddle. The Brutish Soldier watches him go with grudg admiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the PRISONER’S FACE, drenched in sweat. Two guar hold him up while a third brings a lit torch close...

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Stop! The prisoner has had enough. NIZAM, the king’s Grand Vizier (50s, cultured and wise) g the prisoner a sip of water, which he gulps gratefully. The four PRINCES watch the interrogation. Dastan is the youngest. Next are the twins, FARHAD and FARHAN -- identical, equally fastidious aristocrats who don’t like get their gleaming armor dirty. The eldest is TUS, a toug battle-hardened commander.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: Question him again, Nizam; he will tell us who has been supplying our enemy with weapons and armor or he shall face the consequences. Nizam addresses the prisoner in a FOREIGN tongue.. the ma nods in surrender and whispers his response. Nizam reacts with surprise, then turns to face the others.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Noble princes. The prisoner begs for mercy. He has confessed the identity of their secret ally.. He points to a spot on a parchment map with Arabic calligraphy. The four brothers crane to see.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It is the city of Alamut that has been arming our enemy.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: (frowns ) Alamut? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought they were rumored to be an ancient race of holy people...

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: What care we for rumors, brother? If they have sided with our foe, then Alamut must pay the price. Tus gives his younger brother a stern look.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: Our father, the King, would not decide so rashly. I will consider all arguments. Farhan clears his throat-- his brother speaks:

dialogues.speaker: FARHAD
dialogues.text: Does Alamut have treasure?

dialogues.speaker: FARHAN
dialogues.text: He’s only asking because it has been a long campaign...

dialogues.speaker: FARHAD
dialogues.text: We're thinking of the men.

dialogues.speaker: FARHAN
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Treasure. Food. Beautiful women. Alamut is renowned for them.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Nevermind the plunder-- the friend of our enemy is our enemy. Tus remains undecided.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: I would have more proof.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: I’m afraid the proof you seek lies within the walls of Alamut itself: secret forges, swords, spears... but Alamut is a mighty Citadel that has never fallen. You would risk much to attempt it, Prince. He bows deeply: the decision is not his to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What say you, brothers? Dastan draws his sword, a thirst for glory in his eyes. Farhad and Farhan follow suit -- a thirst for treasure in theirs. Tus looks at them. swayed, he draws his sword as well.

dialogues.speaker: TUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then let their fortress come down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF SHOTS: Footsoldiers on the move. Catapults pushed on wheels. The Persian Cavalry on horseback. PULL BACK TO REVEAL... an ever greater number of soldiers the army’s advance gains momentum...

dialogues.speaker: THE PERSIAN ARMY
dialogues.text: Emerges from the morning fog. Thousands of men and horses A stunning, fearsome sight. Ahead, in the shadow of the mountain, a massive fortress rises from the mist like the home of the gods... THE CITADEL OF ALAMUT. Ancient, mysterious and impregnabl The common soldiers at Dastan’s side look shaken and make superstitious gestures to ward off evil.

dialogues.speaker: FEARFUL SOLDIER
dialogues.text: They say the Alamut are sorcerers. Black magic.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I expect they’re flesh and bone, like us. Dastan rides ahead to join his older brothers on the ridg completing a quartet of horsemen. The PRINCES take in Alamut for the first time with their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: FARHAD
dialogues.text: We're going to get dirty, aren’t we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only get dirty if you actually fight. Do that and I’1l polish your armor for you.

dialogues.speaker: FARHAN
dialogues.text: (looks Dastan up and down) You’d do better to polish your own.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: Come. Let’s make our father proud. They gallop off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gossamer curtains billow in the breeze. A girl tosses in fitful sleep. Smooth limbs, long black hair -- the darkne offers only a tantalizing hint of the beauty that is TAMI A GONG rings out. Tamina awakens, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SENTRY beats a giant GONG. ALAMUT SOLDIERS run past shouting in Foreign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PERSIAN ARMY charges up the wide shaly slope. Tus, galloping ahead, lifts his sword and lets out a WAR From the ranks rises a blood-curdling NOISE as thousands voices join him. Then... A FLAMING ARROW is fired from the ramparts. All eyes turn skyward to follow its arc. At its apex, the arrow suddenly EXPLODES into a shower of brilliant white fireworks, illuminating the attacking arm

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Is mesmerized; the Persians have never seen gunpowder bef Suddenly an ARROW fells the man next to him. Dastan instinctively raises his shield, blocking another ARROW.  Dastan’s eagle eye spots ALAMUT ARCHERS hidden among the rocks above. They’re clad in black, like ninjas.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: There! Persian archers return fire. Tus, in the vanguard shouts-

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: To the walls! Attack!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the ocean tide crashing against a sea wall, the firs wave of footsoldiers reaches the citadel. Ladders are thr up; men scale the walls-- ALAMUT SOLDIERS, rise from hiding to meet them with arrow and burning oil. Persian soldiers and ladders fall. The battlefield is chaos. All around, men are felled by arrows. Dastan spots the problem -- ninja-like ALAMUT SABOTEURS darting like shadows among the troops.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: The enemy is here! Dastan gallops toward a SABOTEUR who’s just doused a cata with oil. Leaping from horseback onto the catapult, he strikes the torch from the man’s hand before he can light They clash swords. The Saboteur, an intimidating spectre swathed in black is a formidable swordsman. But Dastan ho his own with surprising skill. A SECOND SABOTEUR joins in. Despite Dastan’s speed and agility, the two Saboteurs inexorably force him up onto t catapult platform. While #1 keeps him busy, #2 lights a torch. The catapult BURSTS INTO FLAMES. Dastan battles on with determination, heedless of the FLA rising around him. At last he turns the tables and knocks both Saboteurs off the platform into the flames. A moment of satisfaction... Then Dastan sees the TIE ROPE burning. Uh oh. He looks down, realizes what he’s standing on... Just as the ROPE BURNS THROUGH. The catapult arm FLINGS Dastan into the air. He soars to the ramparts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alamut SOLDIERS, fighting off the invaders, look up to se enemy soldier hurtling toward them like a cannonball. Whizzing over their heads, Dastan makes a desperate grab passing canvas awning. It RIPS -- but slows his flight as tears through a series of canvas awnings, one after anoth Dastan’s amazed he’s survived until... He runs out of awnings. Confronted with a FATAL DROP to t next rampart, he saves himself by grabbing the torn canva the last awning. On the rampart below, a trio of ARCHERS take aim. Dastan dangles in space, a prime target. Pushing off the stone wall with his feet, he struggles to climb the torn canvas. The first volley of arrows barely misses him. Dastan climbs faster. As he nears the top.. The canvas RIPS -- dropping him further than before and SLAMMING him into the wall. (Thanks to which, the second volley misses him too.) Dastan gets a new idea. He starts to “run” back and forth along the wall, swinging on the canvas to gain momentum. The cloth RIPS more. Not good. He’s hanging by a thread. His eye is on a nearby parapet: if he can swing to it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Persian soldiers on the narrow bridge leading to the cita run a BATTERING RAM into the iron gate. Heave-ho! BAM! And again. BAM! The battering ram SMASHES through the gat The triumphant horde storms through the vaulted entrance- Only to find themselves confronted by a SECOND GATE! A TORRENT OF ARROWS is unleashed on them from above. They'r trapped by the men rushing in; it’s a slaughter.  10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Running on the wall, Dastan swings almost within reach of parapet... just misses it. He swings back the other way; ARROW grazes him. Below him, two more ARCHERS join the firing squad. They l their bows. With determination, Dastan backs up as far as he can for final swing, the one that has to make it... As he’s swinging toward the parapet, his canvas “rope” BREAKS. Dastan sails through the air... Grabs for the parapet.. misses it.. plummets toward earth And, brilliantly, saves himself by grabbing a window ledg below. Scrambles through, just escaping a hail of ARROWS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan lands in a stone corridor. FIVE ALAMUT SOLDIERS converge on him. He draws his sword. And now we see Dastan fighting in his element. His style medieval Parkour; he uses walls, railings, statuary-- anything he can bounce, grab or roll off of for an advant Fighting him is like trying to grab hold of a bar of soap At one point, under double attack, Dastan reaches for his dagger-- only to find the sheath empty. Oh yeah, he gambl it away. CURSING, he ducks one blow while blocking anothe Dastan runs to the edge, looks down over the parapet. HIS POV: The main bridge below, clogged with soldiers. Beside him, thick rope cables rise from an open SHAFT.

dialogues.speaker: ALAMUT SOLDIER, (IN FOREIGN)
dialogues.text: Stop him! As the soldiers descend on him, Dastan jumps onto the mai CABLE and does a fireman’s slide to the platform below.  11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan lands; GUARDS rush him. He flips one, sends the ne plummeting down the shaft -- grabs a crank lever--

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Dastan THROWS the lever, releasing the crank, which TURNS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHEER erupts from the horde of Persian soldiers as the RAISES. Men pour into the citadel.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE GATE
dialogues.text: TUS stares in disbelief as the bridge empties of men.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: To the bridge! FROM ALL SIDES, soldiers pour onto the narrow bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina gazes out the window. A HANDMAID bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: HANDMAID
dialogues.text: My Lady! We must flee! The invaders have breached the gate!

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: What? How did this happen?

dialogues.speaker: HANDMAID
dialogues.text: There is no time-- you must save yourself!

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: There is far more at stake than my safety. The Handmaid bows her head in acknowledgment. Tamina rema calm and self-possessed.  12.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Send word to collapse the passages to the Hourglass. And have the dagger brought to me.

dialogues.speaker: HANDMAID
dialogues.text: Yes my lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A courtyard of austere and exotic Eastern beauty. At the end stands a temple with a sacred FOUNTAIN guarded by sto lions -- all carved out of a massive block of pure white marble. A flood of Persian soldiers soon overwhelms the defenders

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Civilians flee screaming through narrow stone streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The twins fight side by side without breaking a sweat. Nizam rides through the enemy troops wielding two swords once with a deadly dexterity surprising for a man his age Tus, hacking his way to victory, pauses --

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: Where’s Dastan? EXT. ANOTHER RAMPART —- DAY Dastan emerges onto a quiet rampart -- a narrow trench between two high walls. The battle has not yet reached th part of the castle. A FLASH OF LIGHT catches Dastan’s eye.. he looks up at an arched window where somebody is signalling with a small h mirror.. a fleeting glimpse of a beautiful female silhoue behind a sheer curtain: Tamina. Then.. HOOFBEATS. Dastan turns to see a mighty ALAMUT WARRIOR galloping toward him on an armored stallion.  13. Dastan’s trapped between the walls. The corridor is too narrow for him to escape. He’s about to be trampled. The WARRIOR draws a scimitar... At the last instant Dastan runs straight up the wall-- pu off with a backflip and lands ON THE HORSE! The two men GRAPPLE on horseback. Sparks fly as armor and weapons scrape the stone walls at full gallop. They fight -- Dastan getting the worst of it as his more heavily-armored opponent pounds him mercilessly. The Alam warrior raises his sword to finish Dastan once and for al Dastan throws his arms around the warrior’s waist, draggi him from the saddle. The two men crash to the ground. Dastan fights his way loose. Only then does he realize th the man he is struggling with is dead; an ARROW protrudes from his back. Dastan looks up to see Persian SOLDIERS running toward them.

dialogues.speaker: PERSIAN SOLDIER
dialogues.text: The horse! Get the horse! The soldiers run greedily past Dastan after the riderless horse, leaving him alone with the fallen warrior. Dastan removes the warrior’s helmet. His face is noble an in agony; worse than the mortal wound is the shame of his failure... Dastan removes his breastplate to give him air TAMINA’S POV - from a window above she looks down and see Dastan kneeling over the body. The young warrior tries to speak-- Dastan cranes closer t hear his last words -- too late. He’s dead. Dastan slumps to a seated position, spent. We HEAR the victorious Persian soldiers looting the city in the dista Dastan notices a cloth-wrapped bundle tucked into the dea warrior’s waistband, under his armor. He pulls it out. Unwraps it. It’s a ceremonial DAGGER with a glass handle encrusted wi precious stones. Ancient and otherwordly, as if it had be made by the gods, not men.  14. The glass handle is half-filled with a fine white sand, s naturally bright it glows. Dastan tilts it curiously, the way you might tilt an hourglass. Glad to have it, Dastan sheathes the dagger in his own em scabbard... ON TAMINA - her eyes burn with fury as she watches. Dasta clothes are charred and torn from his escapades-- she tak him for the lowest sort of thief, one who loots the bodie the dead for easy plunder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan emerges and spots his brothers conferring with Niz amidst the crowd of soldiers. He approaches.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: (to Tus) It stands to reason that their secret armories are well concealed. Why not leave a team behind here to search for them?

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: (spotting his brother) Dastan. Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Tus, I opened the gate! Tus, in a bad mood, snaps--

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: Every man here played his part. Don’t take credit for their bravery. The Twins sneer and turn their back on Dastan, resuming t previous conversation...

dialogues.speaker: FARHAD
dialogues.text: (eager for booty) Nizam is right. Why don’t I stay and search for the armories?

dialogues.speaker: FARHAN
dialogues.text: Why not me?  15.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: All of you -- return home. I myself shall conduct the search for these weapons that we came to find. The steel in his tone warns them all not to argue further

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: (bows deeply) We hear and obey, my prince.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE COURTYARD
dialogues.text: An OFFICER inspects a group of captive YOUNG WOMEN the soldiers have brought in. Among them is Tamina, her fine white dress concealed under a drab cloak. Tamina evades the Officer’s gaze; he lifts her chin to ge good look at her face.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Let’s see your hands. Tamina shows one hand. The Officer yanks the other into view, then gives her a rough whole-body frisk. Tamina suppresses her shame and anger as he moves on the to next girl. REVEAL: Tamina’s palmed the ornate RING she was wearing earlier. She slips it unnoticed into the folds of her clo Across the courtyard she spots Dastan. Her eyes burn into him, and especially into the DAGGER in his belt..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A caravan of Persian SOLDIERS, HORSES and CAMELS wends it way down from the forbidding, icy mountain peaks. Dastan sits backward in his saddle, reading a book. Nizam rides up alongside.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Your brothers do you an injustice. You turned the battle.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I don’t need their praise. Nizam smiles.  16.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: You have much to learn about the ways of politics, Dastan. Praise, flattery, renown -- these are the currency of power in court. Nizam gestures toward a row of carts laden with booty.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, your brothers bring your father treasures, trophies of war. What have you brought to gain his favor?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I’d rather earn his favor honestly.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: How so? Dastan puts away his book and turns around in the saddle.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Nizam, why do we win victories? Because we have the greatest army. The army he built, with his life’s blood, starting from nothing. That was an accomplishment. What have I done thus far except go along for the ride?

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: To be the son of a great king-- even a fourth son-- is a destiny most men would envy.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Do you know what I want? To set forth from home with no army, just one horse and a good sword, and no one knowing I am the son of Shahraman. Then my achievements may be small-- but they’1l be mine. And I can bring them home to him with pride.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: (with a twinkle) Dastan, I have misjudged you. I thought you the most modest of my King’s sons. In fact, you are the most ambitious.  17.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I’m not joking, Nizam. I will do it. As soon as we arrive, I’1l ask my father for his blessing.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: You'd do well to bring a gift.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Perhaps you’re right. If only I’d asked for a share of the loot... Dastan casts a glance at one of the CARTS piled high with rich silks, tapestries and gold...

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you think Tus would mind..?

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Well... you did open the gate. Nizam winks at him and spurs his horse onward. Dastan, alone for the moment, trots his horse close to a cart. He scans the treasures and selects a gorgeous, embroidered silk ROBE as a gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun sets behind the gleaming spires and domes of the royal city of NASAF. TILT DOWN to REVEAL the dusty carava finally arriving home. The returning soldiers are met by a cheering crowd. The Captain of the Guards, GARSIV (a young hotshot) stand attention for the returning nobles. His expression sours when Dastan comes abreast of him: the two are about the s age, and clearly have some history.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: No injuries, Dastan? Didn’t your brothers let you fight?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Hardly at all, Garsiv. I’m very rusty; maybe you’ll be able to beat me in the tournament this year. Finally. Dastan smiles tauntingly and rides past.  18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A magnificent eighth century palace with high vaulted ceilings and tiled mosaics. Musicians play flutes and tambourines, beautiful slaves circulate, serving delicacies to the guests (all male), seated on cushions at low tables.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Is part of a group of newbie SLAVE GIRLS being prepped by stern MATRON who makes last minute adjustments to each gi attire before sending her out with an hors d’oeuvre tray. The Matron frowns at Tamina’s outfit, tugs at it to revea more cleavage. Tamina, indignant, seems about to slap her then remembering where she is, submits. Her face burns as the Matron sends her forth with a pat on the ass. FOLLOW the slave girls as they mix into the crowd... and PAST them, to a roped-off royal dais where...

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Tears into a chicken leg with gusto. The Twins, eating wi elegant delicacy shoot him twin looks of disgust.

dialogues.speaker: FARHAD
dialogues.text: You eat like a common foot-soldier.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Foot-soldiers know how to enjoy a good meal when they get one. Bismillah. Dastan halts mid-bite as he sees... TAMINA across the room. He is mesmerized by the sight of her. He drops his chicken and starts toward her..

dialogues.speaker: ON TAMINA
dialogues.text: As she struggles under the weight of the tray. It is unexpectedly lifted from her hands by:

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Allow me.. a delicate flower such as yourself needs care and drink, not heavy labor.  19. With a flourish, he swings the tray to a nearby table, co up with two goblets of wine and offers one to her... Her eyes go wide with recognition; he interprets her reac as fear of being caught by the Matron.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have no fear. I’m Prince Dastan and I hereby grant you a temporary reprieve from your duties.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (IN FOREIGN)
dialogues.text: I have seen you before, you son of a dog. You steal from the dead. I curse your eyes. Dastan laughs modestly, not comprehending a word.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: No, please-- there’s no need to thank me, Slave-Girl. You will find I’m a very modern thinker. Social rank means nothing to me.. As Dastan babbles on, trying to impress Tamina, her eyes to the hilt of the DAGGER in his belt...

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: SO you needn’t be intimidated by the fact that I’m a prince. Although I’m sure it sounds very impressive to you, I’m only a fourth son-- A FANFARE of TRUMPETS signals the start of the royal procession. Everybody surges forward to look; Dastan and Tamina are separated in the crowd...

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: As the Matron catches her without a tray and sends her roughly back to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina ducks out of the line of slaves and doubles back toward the banquet hall.

dialogues.speaker: SIDE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Tamina finds herself alone in a dark hallway.  20. A sliver of light spills out of a door that is ajar. She hesitates and peeks inside... She stares: whatever she sees is definitely something she wasn’t supposed to.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? Somebody grab that girl! Tamina flees. She races down the hall and slips into a laundry room to hide...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KING SHAHRAMAN enters with his entourage. Gray-bearded in silk robes, he’s the aged ruin of a once-powerful warrior All bow deeply as he passes. AT THE DIAS everyone gathers and takes his place.. Garsiv, Captain of the Guards stands sentry behind the throne. Nizam steps to the fore ahead of the princes.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRAMAN
dialogues.text: (embracing Nizam) Nizam, my old friend! Again your wisdom has brought us victory.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Not my wisdom. By your royal faar your sons have brought honor and glory to the banner of Nasaf.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRAMAN
dialogues.text: (suddenly perturbed) Where is my eldest son?

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Tus has remained to bring order to the lands conquered in your name. His brothers will convey his greetings to you. The Twins step forward with elaborately ceremonial, simultaneous bows -- a bit over the top for Shahraman.  21.

dialogues.speaker: FARHAD
dialogues.text: My lord and father, to see you is like seeing the sun after the longest night of winter. Our noble brother has entrusted me--

dialogues.speaker: FARHAN
dialogues.text: Us.

dialogues.speaker: FARHAD
dialogues.text: --has entrusted us with gifts. On cue, TEN SLAVES enter bearing ten gold platters laden jewels, their powerful muscles straining under the weight

dialogues.speaker: FARHAN
dialogues.text: And I bring gifts as well.

dialogues.speaker: FARHAD
dialogues.text: We.

dialogues.speaker: FARHAN
dialogues.text: We bring gifts. Twenty more slaves parade in, bearing twenty golden platt piled even higher than the first.

dialogues.speaker: FARHAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: From Turan and Alamut, out of love for you, we carried the treasure--

dialogues.speaker: FARHAD
dialogues.text: --his as well as ours--

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRAMAN
dialogues.text: Alamut?

dialogues.speaker: FARHAN
dialogues.text: --through treacherous mountains, across the burning desert, and--

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: The Twins quake; did they say something wrong? Dastan is confused as they are. Nizam steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRAMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are these babbling fools saying? Did we conquer Alamut?  22.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: We did, sire.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRAMAN
dialogues.text: The kingdom of Alamut has endured inviolate for centuries as a sacred city. Why did Tus order the attack?

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: O King, your son was provoked by the treachery of Alamut.. when you learn the full truth, you will understand. But look, your youngest son waits to greet you. Shahraman looks at Dastan; his anger melts away. He has a special fondness for this son. Dastan throws himself into his dad's embrace, hugs him hard.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRAMAN
dialogues.text: Dastan. What mischief have you been up to?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Father, I’ve brought you a gift.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRAMAN
dialogues.text: (affectionately) Do you mean to say you haven’t lost it or gambled it away? Dastan beckons to a pretty FEMALE SLAVE who appears carry a cloth bundle -- and in a nifty move, shakes it out, unveiling the ROBE OF HONOR. Everyone oohs. Shahraman takes the robe. Runs his fingers over the gold- embroidered silk. He’s genuinely surprised and touched.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRAMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dastan, this is unlike you. I shall wear it with pride. Attendants remove Shahraman’s robe and help him don the n one. The Twins seethe with jealousy at such favoritism.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (the perfect moment) Father, I wish to speak with you about a very important matter...  23.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRAMAN
dialogues.text: Later, my son. Shahraman mounts the dais and seats himself on the throne

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRAMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now Nizam, tell me of Alamut.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: O King, we discovered information that Alamut was secretly supporting -- My King, is something wrong? The new robe seems to itch Shahraman; he tugs at it irritably.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRAMAN
dialogues.text: It’s hot. Get to the point.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: We learned from a captured Turanian warrior that...

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Father?

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRAMAN
dialogues.text: Take off the robe! Attendants hasten to remove the robe, but cannot. It won’ come off-- it’s glued to his skin. Shahraman ROARS in pai

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Father! ! Shahraman lurches to his feet. Like a maddened bull, he shakes off his attendants, tearing at the robe. STEAM his from the burning places where it STICKS to his flesh.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: It’s poisoned!

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRAMAN
dialogues.text: Take it off! Every one is shocked and horrified. Dastan hurtles to his father’s side. Catches him as he falls, staining his own clothes with blood. Shahraman is dying in agony, with thi degree burns all over his body.

dialogues.speaker: SHAHRAMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: wiy son?  24. Garsiv rushes to help his king. He shoves Dastan aside.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: You’ve killed your father!

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: What? No! I--

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: (shouts ) Prince Dastan has killed the king! Guards rip Dastan away from Shahraman. While he struggles Garsiv and other guards attempt to remove the King’s robe but only intensify his death agony.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (fighting to break free)

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Garsiv lowers Shahraman’s dead body to the ground. He dra his sword and points it at Dastan.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Murderer! The Twins draw their swords as well. All eyes are on Dast

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (choking back tears) I didn’t do this! (looks around desperately) Nizam! Tell them... Nizam looks at him with shocked disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: That is for a tribunal to decide, Dastan. He nods sadly to the guards; they drag Dastan from the ro With a sudden, desperate burst of strength, Dastan breaks free. He snatches a sword from one of the guards, parries the attack of another and... «escapes through a small doorway behind the dais.  25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan runs for his life. Footsteps and shouts behind him He ducks into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan slams the door shut behind him. He turns and sees.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: She stands by the window, holding a rope made of knotted sheets. Obviously preparing her own escape.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Slave-Girl! What strange good fortune-- BAM! BAM! Soldiers are at the door. She pushes him to the window.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan lands with a thud at the bottom of the sheet-rope. Tamina tumbles down on top of him just as he tries to get Tamina leaps to her feet. Dastan is slower getting up.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Thank you for your help, Slave- Girl. Now hide yourself. I must flee at once and doubtless you cannot even-- Tamina mounts a magnificent Arabian THOROUGHBRED and take off at a gallop.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: tide. Dastan stares for a moment. Then the GUARDS burst out of doorway. Dastan leaps onto the nearest available mount-- humiliatingly small and unimpressive pony-- and spurs it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dozen of the King’s HORSEMEN led by Garsiv ride out, trapping Tamina and Dastan. They’re the best-trained, most formidable military unit i Persia. Normally everyone flees from them. Instead, Dasta rides straight at them. He dodges right -- then left -- and slips by: Magic Johns on horseback. The resulting moment of disarray lets Tamin charge past on the other side and out the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Close the gate! As the GUARDS relay Garsiv’s command like an echo, the do horsemen turn around as one to give chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two fugitives gallop toward the great, lowering iron gate, Garsiv’s posse on their heels. Tamina’s larger and faster horse gets there first. Dastan catches a glimpse of her nimbly swinging sideways in her saddle to avoid decapitation as she rides under the closi gate. Impressive. But it looks like the gate will close before Dastan gets there. To make matters worse, four FOOTSOLDIE range out in front of it, with spears raised to impale hi Dastan’s eyes narrow. Redoubling his speed, he charges on and SHATTERS a spear with his sword, opening space to pas He swings halfway off his horse and narrowly squeezes through. The gate closes, sealing in Garsiv’s men.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Open the gate!! The soldiers raise the gate they just closed. Garsiv’s posse, which has swelled to forty riders, charges through

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan and Tamina gallop out of the walled city and strik out toward the hills with the king’s men in pursuit. A full moon illuminates the rough terrain. Tamina leads t way over a series of increasingly treacherous jumps.  27.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (amazed) Where did you learn to ride so well, Slave-Girl? Two pursuing horsemen fall jumping the boulders. The othe press closer... An ARROW whistles past Dastan’s head. He looks over his shoulder, sees the posse gaining on him. He urges the lit horse to greater speed but he’s outclassed. Inexorably, the first ARCHER draws even with Dastan. He shoots; Dastan drops from sight! The archer, seeing Dasta horse riderless, is momentarily confused -- did he hit hi No, Dastan is clinging to the saddle on the other side, shielded by the horse’s body.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Shoot the horse! Dastan, half upside-down, registers alarm on hearing this As the archer fires, Dastan pops back up in his saddle an pulls up the reins -- causing the arrow to miss. Dastan escapes into a narrow GULLY, forcing his pursuers follow single file. Descending the steep gully, Dastan discovers the true gif his undersized mount -- he’s a mountain horse. The sure- footed animal rapidly regains the ground he lost. Reckles tackling the treacherous slope, Dastan emerges onto a bro plateau -- ahead of Tamina. Dastan’s pursuers benefit from the shortcut as well. As t pour out of the gully they land right on Tamina. She weav trying to shake them, but can’t escape. Dastan looks back, sees Tamina in trouble. He slows. A mistake. Within moments he too is boxed in by soldiers on all sides. He can’t get to Tamina. To Dastan’s left runs the sheer canyon wall. As his horse draws up alongside it, he STANDS, perching on the saddle a circus rider -- then RUNS up the wall, using the horse' galloping momentum to GRAB an overhanging shrub. The soldiers are left herding a riderless horse. Dastan launches off the wall and DROPS onto one of the ri harassing Tamina, shoves him out of the saddle and takes place. Drawing his sword, he fights his way toward Tamina knocking off the soldiers one by one.  28. Suddenly Dastan’s trapped between two riders: Garsiv on h left, another on his right. In a blinding series of sword clashes, Garsiv forces Dastan to parry repeatedly... leav himself wide open to the soldier on his right.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Dastan, look out! Dastan BLOCKS the right-hand soldier’s blow in the nick o time. Garsiv turns to see Tamina riding up on his own lef Dastan doesn’t waste a moment. He scrambles across Garsiv saddle and joins Tamina on hers. Garsiv spins furiously t stop him-- too slow. They take off at a gallop.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: You have more than repaid the small kindness I showed you, Slave-Girl! Tamina’s eyes narrow: this guy is clueless. But there’s n time to disabuse him-- both halves of the posses are clos in on them. Up ahead the plateau drops off in a SHEER CLI Dastan spots his small horse running loose. Taking the re from Tamina, he draws up alongside.. and JUMPS into the saddle. He reaches out to Tamina.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on! Jump!

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: This horse is faster!

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Yes, but it’s not a mountain horse! Trust me, jump! Tamina hesitates.. then JUMPS from her horse to his. Dast catches her and hauls her up into the saddle. As the soldiers close in, Dastan turns to face the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! Dastan sets his jaw. Gallops straight toward the edge -- And LEAPS out into empty space.  29. The cliff is not quite sheer, just very steep. Incredibly the horse hits the nearly vertical slope at a gallop -- straight downhill. All the King’s horses stop at the edge. Garsiv, in a fren beats his horse, urging it on. But it refuses to continue Dastan and Tamina hang on as the sure-footed mountain hor gallops down, skirting rocks and potholes where a single misstep could mean death, until they reach the canyon flo Garsiv, stranded at the top of the cliff, watches in help fury as his quarry disappears into the canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shallow river flows between sheer canyon walls. They ri Tamina is quiet and impassive. Dastan thinks aloud.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Who would want to frame me for my father’s murder?

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Where did the poisoned robe come from?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: It was among the gifts sent by my eldest brother, Tus...

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: And who inherits the throne upon your father’s death?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Tus. His head spins. He rides ashore and dismounts.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I would never have believed my own brother was capable of-- As he turns to face Tamina, she swings a SWORD right at h Dastan dodges by sheer reflex; the blow glances off his armor, sending him sprawling. He rolls, avoiding a stamping horses hoof that would have split his skull. He scrambles to his feet, drawing his sw in time to BLOCK Tamina’s next blow.  30.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are you--?! Tamina attacks without mercy. Dastan, his arm deadened fr the first hit, struggles to defend himself. Tamina is good, but not really a match for Dastan. With e failed attack, Dastan recovers ground until Tamina has lo her initial surprise advantage. Dastan counter-attacks with blinding speed -- he’s not tr to kill Tamina, just disarm her. Finally he strikes the sword from her hand.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who taught you how to use a sword, Slave-Girl? Tamina surprises him with a KICK in the belly. Seizing Dastan’s arm, she sweeps his legs out from under him. The hit the ground together, grappling on the riverbank. Tamina sees an opening; pulls the dagger from Dastan’s be He grabs her wrist, flips her. The dagger goes flying. Tamina pushes him off her, scrambles toward the dagger. Dastan gets there first. He snatches it up-- CLICK! Grasping it, he’s pressed a JEWEL on the dagger’s glass handle. A trickle of white SAND spills out and land at his feet. He looks down surprised...

dialogues.speaker: WHAM
dialogues.text: TIME slows to a STOP, the dagger frozen in Dastan’s hand. The law of physics itself is suspended: dust and water droplets hang in midair. The only element of the scene th remains in motion is the white-glowing sand; as it hits t ground, a gust of WIND blows it away...

dialogues.speaker: REWIND
dialogues.text: TIME RUNS BACKWARD, reversing the previous action. Faster and faster -- Tamina and Dastan fight in reverse, their movements accelerating backward in a BLUR -- until --

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN,
dialogues.text: Staring amazed at the dagger clenched in his hand, sudden relaxes his tight grip. The instant he releases the jewel the sand stops pouring out -- and  31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan and Tamina, together again on horseback, ride asho as they did the first time. Tamina is repeating:

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: «who inherits the throne upon your father’s death? Dastan jumps off the horse in confusion and terror, backs away from Tamina as if she’s a witch.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: You-- Turning, he points to the dusty patch of ground where the were just fighting. Or were they? Tamina is equally perplexed. Dastan looks down at his emp hand -- then at the dagger, which inexplicably, is back i his belt... And looks up to see Tamina’s SWORD flashing toward him. Disoriented by what’s happened, Dastan is slower to react this time; the blade SLASHES him across the chest. Dastan looks down at the spreading stain of BLOOD soaking tunic. He takes a step forward; buckles, falls to his kne

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who are you? Tamina draws herself up imperiously, takes out the RING s kept hidden and puts it on her finger.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: I am Tamina, daughter of Sarkander, King of Alamut.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (mortally wounded) What... magic..? He looks down at the dagger in his belt. Draws it.  32.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Give back what you have stolen. Dastan studies the dagger. The jewel gleams on its hilt, just above where a hand would normally grasp the dagger. if he grasps it this way, as he did when he snatched it u

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t! She makes a grab for the dagger -- Dastan presses the jew CLICK! Again, sand pours from the handle -- STOPPING TIME REWIND! ! Back through time, reversing the preceding acti This time, Dastan is more aware of what’s happening. It’s if he’s stepped outside himself, outside space and time, a different dimension from which he can watch the rewind. looks down at the dagger in his hand -- just as the last the sand drains out, leaving the glass handle empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME RESUMES a moment before Tamina swings her sword at h This time Dastan draws his sword and blocks the blow. She tries to duel him but he’s the stronger swordsman. He disarms her and sends her sprawling to the ground. He glances down -- to his amazement, his wound has vanish

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I don’t want to hurt you, but if you reach for that sword I will stop you before you stab me again.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Again? Her gaze flies to the dagger in Dastan’s belt.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The dagger.. you’ve used up all the sand! Dastan checks the dagger. Indeed, its glass handle is emp

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: How did you know..?  33.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: (catches herself) Everybody from Alamut knows the myth... Tamina prostrates herself, avoiding his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m merely a foolish Slave-Girl. Forgive me for striking at you Prince. I sought to escape. Dastan looks down, lets her grovel. He realizes she has n memory of having revealed her true identity to him. a lit smile creeps over his face.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I will forgive you Slave-Girl. But come-- we cannot stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina sweats, building up the fire while Dastan lounges.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: That’s enough wood. Come over here; my boots are dirty. Her eyes burn into him: if looks could kill.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is something wrong, Slave-Girl?

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: (through gritted teeth) No, my lord. She kneels to clean his boots. Dastan takes out the dagge and holds it in front of her, watching to see her reactio

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: A dagger that can turn back time... what else does your legend say? She shrugs and replies offhandedly.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Only that it is worthless now that it’s empty.  34. Dastan presses the jewel again and again. Indeed, nothing happens. Suspicious, he puts it back in his belt. She finishes with one boot. He lifts the other and places in front of her; he watches her intently, trying to guess whatever it is she’s NOT telling him. Outside the sky begins to lighten.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: The sun is coming up. It’s almost time for me to go.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Go where?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: To Alamut to confront my brother. If he is indeed responsible for our father’s death... (touches the dagger) «then I will kill him. Dastan strides toward the entrance and saddles the horse. Tamina follows him.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: How will you reach him with the entire Persian army looking for you?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I’ll find a way.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: You don’t even speak our language... He hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know the secret passageways, the back alleys, the local streets of Alamut.. I can help you. He turns back toward her, considering.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: For a common Slave-Girl you have a remarkable set of talents. (a beat) Show me your hands.  35. Eager to please, Tamina shows him two empty hands. Dastan grabs both her wrists and deftly ties them together. Over Tamina’s protests, he lifts her into the saddle.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You may indeed prove useful. But you lie far too well to be trusted, Princess Tamina. Her face flushes with indignation.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: You knew? And you made me clean your boots!? He grins and swings up into the saddle behind her.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Yes, and you did an excellent job-- for a Princess. He spurs the horse and they ride off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garsiv strides in, dusty from the chase. Nizam and the Tw look up from their conference.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: My lords, he has the luck of the devil himself.

dialogues.speaker: FARHAD
dialogues.text: Was it his luck or your failure?

dialogues.speaker: FARHAN
dialogues.text: The King’s Guards against one solitary man?

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: He wasn’t alone, my Prince; there was a girl... As soon as the words are out of his mouth, Garsiv regrets them. His face burns with shame.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: (sadly) If only he hadn't fled...  36.

dialogues.speaker: FARHAD
dialogues.text: If he fled then he’s guilty...

dialogues.speaker: FARHAN
dialogues.text: If he’s guilty he must be punished.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: He is your brother...

dialogues.speaker: FARHAD
dialogues.text: The king was our father. Apprehend him.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: (bows ) As you wish, my Princes... Garsiv, prepare a full regiment this time.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Right away, my lord. Garsiv is out for blood. Nizam notes his eagerness.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: I, myself will accompany the search party to make sure Prince Dastan is treated with justice. (turns to the Twins) Tus is our king now. Until he returns, you rule Nasaf.

dialogues.speaker: FARHAD
dialogues.text: (delighted) I rule!

dialogues.speaker: FARHAN
dialogues.text: I rule. Nizam hesitates as he looks from one to the other... then second thought, simply settles into a courtier’s smile.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Precisely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a thunder of hooves, soldiers of Nasaf descend on a CARAVAN of hundreds of travelers flowing through the pass The soldiers start grabbing people, searching for anyone remotely matching Dastan or Tamina’s description.  37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan and Tamina watch the caravan below, and more soldi riding toward the pass. Intent on the problem, they don’t notice the ARCHER above drawing a bead on them.. until Tamina turns with a gasp. It’s a 12 year-old SHEPHERD BOY, guarding his flock. Dastan makes a friendly “excuse us” gesture, and hustles Tamina along. Fiercely scowling, the boy keeps the bow an arrow trained on them as they pass. Seized by an afterthought, Dastan turns back...

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now naked, the boy runs toward his hut shouting--

dialogues.speaker: SHEPHERD BOY
dialogues.text: Papa! Papa! Waving in his hand Dastan’s SILVER BRACELET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina, dressed_as_a_shepherd boy, rides the boy’s mule a Dastan leads it. Dastan has shed his princely armor and looks like any common traveler. They join the throng of people and animals moving in both directions. As they approach the pass, Tamina tenses up on seeing the dozen SOLDIERS manning the checkpoint.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. I don’t look like a prince of Nasaf.. (looks her up and down) «any more than you look like a girl. Tamina glowers but Dastan doesn’t notice. They pass direc in front of the soldiers, unnoticed.  38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blazing sun beats down on the parched earth as the caravan crosses the desert. Pilgrims, merchants, dervishe civil servants... a panorama of medieval Persia. Pale and weak, Tamina sways in the saddle, tied in place turban cloth. A SERVANT from a group of wealthier Persians passing by offers Dastan a water-skin. He takes it thankfully and raises it to his lips-- stops as he notices Tamina out of corner of his eye, dehydrated and exhausted. Dastan lowers the water-skin and instead gives her a drin She gulps it down, unaware of his small act of generosity Dastan nods his thanks to the Servant as he passes it bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan and Tamina (now on foot) look down on their carava it continues without them. They’re on their own. In the distance rise the icy peaks of Tamina’s mountain kingdom.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: We've no food and only one water- skin.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: God will provide. Come. She doesn’t move, just looks down at her wrists-- still bound. Dastan sighs, then comes over and releases her. He moves on briskly so as not to make a big deal of it.. «and thus misses the murderous stare she gives him, rubbi her wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan and Tamina climb a steep little stream until a NOM CAMP comes into view below. A dozen tents; mules and oxen Hungrily, Dastan sniffs the cooking aromas.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I told you. God will provide. He watches from behind a rock, hiding.  39.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: You mean to steal these people’s food?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: They’re bandits. It all evens out.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Bandits? THEIR POV: A few fierce-looking NOMAD MEN emerge. They al wear weapons. Tamina doesn’t like the looks of this.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Wait for me here. He dashes down the hill before she can stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan sneaks between the tents. There are people around, but he manages to avoid being seen. He ducks into a tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan checks a few bowls and a copper pot -- all empty. Looking around, he spots something hanging in a cloth; sn it. Inside is a giant lump of dried buttermilk curd. He tastes it: not bad. Famished he shoves a big handful into his mouth, takes the rest to go. Startled by a MOO, he turns to see a CALF watching him fr dark corner of the tent. Dastan and the calf share a moment: “Okay, you caught me. Then Dastan ducks out. And back inside in an instant, as FEROCIOUSLY BARKING DOG descend on the tent. Dastan hastily ties the entrance fla shut. The tent SHAKES as the dogs hurl themselves at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOMAD BANDITS, alerted by the BARKING, come to investigat Dastan crawls out from under the other side of the tent. Spotting a CHICKEN strolling by, Dastan snatches it and dashes for the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A six year-old GYPSY BOY sees him. SHOUTS at the top of h lungs in gypsy language -- “There he goes!”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina sees Dastan running up the hill toward her, chicke flapping madly in his grasp, dogs and nomads on his heels

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Run! Tamina hesitates... turns to run. And nearly smacks into. FAROOD. A grizzled gypsy in his fifties. Two rough-looking BANDIT behind him. Utter incredulity on Farood’s face. Dastan arrives, stops short on seeing their escape cut of Turning to face the dogs, he reaches for his sword--

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Offi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On command, the dogs fall back, snarling. Farood looks Dastan up and down. Dastan releases the chicken.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (re: Tamina) My cousin.. he’s hungry.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: A man should take care of his family. I have a family too. A big family. Farood indicates the camp below, where a crowd of curious NOMAD WOMEN and CHILDREN has gathered to watch. Among the the little gypsy BOY, who glares bravely at Dastan.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Did not the Prophet say: “Give freely to those in need, for what you give, God will replace?”

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: A scholar!  41.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I’m only a poor student from Samarkand. My name is Ali. (before Tamina can speak) And this is my cousin, Bukbuk. Alas, he’s mute. Tamina gapes in outrage.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: I am Farood. These are my people; what is mine is theirs. Ali of Samarkand, I will make you a bargain; give me that fine sword you’re wearing and I’1l give you the chicken.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: A sword is worth more than a chicken.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: A chicken is worth more to a hungry thief than a sword to a dead one.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: The worth of a sword depends on who’s wearing it. To gain one sword and one chicken at a cost of-- (surveys the opposition) weight men. Ten if I’m lucky... is hardly taking care of one’s family. Farood rubs his beard thoughtfully.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: You have a high opinion of your own swordsmanship, Ali of Samarkand. Shall we put it to the test? A GIANT BANDIT steps forward. Seven feet tall and grinnin evilly. His friends place TWO SCIMITARS in his hands, whi he brandishes in a blinding display of speed and skill. Dastan quickly recalculates the odds.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Why risk damaging such fine weapons when we could settle the matter with a wager of skill... (dramatic pause) a throw of the knife.  42. The bandits exchange dubious glances. But Dastan has them hooked -- they’re curious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan crouches near a tent, hastily trying to fill the DAGGER with SAND from the desert as he presses the jewel repeatedly. It’s not working.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ali! We’re waiting!

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Just a minute! He makes a final desperate attempt, then gives up. Taking deep breath, he strides into the circle of nomads where.. A WOOD POST with an X has been set up. A loooong fifteen paces away a line in the sand marks Dastan’s throwing spo Tamina looks at Dastan in dismay -- what has he gotten in He’s going to gamble away their only weapon. Dastan gives her a reassuring look. He flips the Dagger in his hand a few times, gauging its weight. The hollow handle makes for an awkward balance... Dastan gets ready.. concentrating.. he catches the unnerv stare of the little Gypsy Boy -- and loses his concentrat False start. Everyone exhales. Dastan gives the kid a reproachful look: “Don’t do that t me!” Gets ready again... And throws. Whop-whop-whop-whop.. PING! The dagger hits the top of th post, handle-first, and bounces off into the sand. A complete miss.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s not a good throwing dagger.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Come. We will speak man to man.  43. Farood squires Dastan away. Tamina, left alone with a doz nomad bandits all staring at her, tries to strike an appropriate “male” attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farood and Dastan pause at the edge of the camp.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: May I ask.. after I take your sword and send you on your way without a chicken, what is your plan?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Without food or weapons, I suppose we'll die in a few days.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: (nods in agreement) Your destination?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Alamut. To find a cure for the curse that struck my cousin dumb.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: It’s not often in this wilderness that I meet a man as educated as myself. Though as you can see, I am virile as a bull -- alas, my wives have given me no sons. Only daughters. Seven wives, eleven daughters. Dastan shakes his head with empathy.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is my great sorrow. All I have learned will die with me, like unpicked grapes that wither on the vine-- for what good is education to a woman? A man of business needs a protogé-- a partner. Where will I find such a man among this bunch of louts? (waves toward the bandits) One might as easily teach a goat to speak.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Your daughters are unmarried?

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: They are like eleven moons, each more beautiful than the next. I have yet to find the man worthy of them. Dastan looks back toward camp, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We travel the same road. Did not the Prophet say it is a duty to give hospitality to those in need? Tonight, before we strike camp, we will cook the chicken you did not win. My gift to you and your poor cousin. It’s the chicken that clinches it -- as Farood knows.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: And my sword?

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: My sword. You may carry it, as long as you are in my caravan. What is in my caravan is mine; it pleases me for you to carry it. Farood strides off, leaving Dastan bemused. Tamina, outraged, comes up to him.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: You can’t seriously mean for us to travel with these people?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: They’re gypsies! They'd sell us out for a handful of copper.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Shh! You’re mute. Left alone to simmer, Tamina notices a female nomad (HALE gazing at her. Haleema, big enough to snap Tamina like a toothpick, smiles coquettishly. Tamina scowls and looks away. Haleema’s smile broadens: she’s in love.  45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCOUT PATROL of half a dozen men rides down from the mountains to rejoin a FULL REGIMENT of the Persian army-- hundreds of horsemen with a well-equipped supply train. NIZAM and GARSIV Are approached by the SCOUT CHIEF, holding Dastan’s brace

dialogues.speaker: SCOUT CHIEF
dialogues.text: A shepherd in the Alburz pass says his son traded his clothes for it. To a man and a woman.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: The Alburz pass.. They’re headed for Alamut.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: His brother Tus stands between him and the crown. We must prevent him from getting there!

dialogues.speaker: THE REGIMENT
dialogues.text: redoubles its speed, horses kicking up dust as they go..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The NOMAD CARAVAN wends its way along a mountain path, pa animals carrying the rolled up tents and mats. Tamina watches Dastan, up ahead, showing off by doing handsprings between two mules. The nomads, including the little boy, laugh and applaud. Dastan falls back to rejoi Tamina.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: How nice. You’ve found friends on your own level.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: At least gypsies know how to have fun.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: I’m talking about the mules. Dastan makes a face: very funny.  46. He notices that she’s limping -- her feet are tender.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Not used to trekking across the desert?

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: I’m fine. Dastan shrugs. He hears muffled laughter and turns to see several gypsy WOMEN riding up on camels. Exotically beautiful, they giggle and whisper behind their veils. Da steps away from his “mute cousin” to wave and smile at th girls. Tamina shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: ON FAROOD
dialogues.text: Dastan comes up beside him.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: You chose your words well. A moon shines at night, but even daylight cannot veil its beauty. (off Farood’s confusion) Your daughters.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: (sees where Dastan looks) Oh, those aren’t my daughters! I wouldn’t let them dress like that. Those are my daughters. Dastan follows his gesture to see... FAROOD’S ELEVEN DAUGHTERS Riding in a wagon. Strong as men and twice as homely, the glare at Dastan (Haleema among them).

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve brought them up properly. Hard workers-- and every one a virgin. Dastan stares. Any one of them could break him in two.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As my partner you could become a rich man very quickly. Perhaps you could afford to marry all my daughters.  47. Dastan smiles queasily...

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you wish to know the secret of my success? War. (confidentially) Alamut has fallen to a foreign army. A great piece of luck-- for us! War is hard on soldiers and common people. But for men of vision, war is an opportunity. Salt, cloth, things nobody thinks twice of in times of peace-- overnight the price goes up tenfold. This is why Farood will take his tribe to Alamut. (a wink re: his daughters) Think about my offer. Beaming he claps Dastan on the back and rides off. Dastan looks back at the daughters as they pass...

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Haleema offers her a water flask. Tamina shakes her head, attempting to simultaneously convey masculinity, lack of interest and muteness. Haleema insists. Tamina gives in a drinks from the flask. Farood’s other ten daughters hoot with delight, startling Tamina into a coughing fit. Haleema beams adoringly. Apparently, sharing water is a significant nomad courtshi As Tamina walks past, Dastan winks at her:

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I see you’ve found a friend too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The caravan is camped. Dastan uses the DAGGER to play MUMBLETYPEG with the gypsy boy. He pauses, hearing a distant noise. Then the noise grows into a THUNDER. Moments later, HORSEMEN appear. A cavalry regiment charges past on the road above. Dastan moves through the camp. He finds Tamina sitting al by a fire.  48.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Soldiers of Nasaf.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Looking for us?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Looking for a man and woman travelling alone. I think we’re safe with the caravan. He notices Tamina rubbing her raw and aching feet. She quickly covers them. He turns away, not wanting to embarrass her further. But he’s concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crossroads of the world. The locals are Mongolian and wear the boots and fur hats of the steppe. Travelers run gamut of the Silk Road from Arab to Chinese. Nomads feed and water their animals at the central trough while merchants haggle in the surrounding BAZAAR. TAMINA draws water from a well. Dastan arrives, leading a DONKEY. He grins broadly.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: About what? He sweeps his arm grandly toward the animal.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: The donkey. I got it for you. On account of your feet... (prompting her) ‘Oh, thank you Dastan! You’re so considerate, such a gentleman--’

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Where did you get it?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: At the bazaar, what--

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: I mean HOW did you get it? What did you trade for it? Dastan looks down at where she is staring: the empty shea on his belt. He traded the DAGGER.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: It was a lousy throwing dagger...

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: You traded the dagger for a donkey! ?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: What? You said yourself that it was worthless without the sand, that the magic was used up.. (off her look) The magic wasn’t used up?

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: (explodes ) NO! I was lying, you idiot! Couldn’t you tell? A few people turn and stare. Dastan hustles her aside bef anybody from their caravan notices that she’s a talking M

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Maybe if you told me the truth once in a while, we wouldn’t have these little communication problems. Tamina takes a calming breath. Considers. Realizes she’s going to have to tell him a bit more.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: It’s the sand that turns back time.. the dagger is the vessel. It can be refilled when we get to Alamut.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (deadpan ) So you’re saying it’s worth more than the donkey? She gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: We need to get it back.  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun burns high overhead. Tamina looks on as Dastan haggles with a Hogarth-grotesque, ONE-EYED MERCHANT.

dialogues.speaker: ONE-EYED MERCHANT
dialogues.text: «describe this dagger for me once again?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: It’s about this long, with a clear handle and it has a bunch of jewels on the hilt-- fake, fake jewels, they’re glass, I’m pretty sure. But the merchant I got the donkey from said that--

dialogues.speaker: ONE-EYED MERCHANT
dialogues.text: Where is the donkey? Dastan sighs. He explains patiently:

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I traded back the donkey in exchange for the chickens that he traded for the dagger and that led me to the bushels of wheat, then the length of cloth and finally... (lifts a jar triumphantly) «this jar of perfume that you traded for my dagger. The One-Eyed Merchant sniffs the jar. Reacts.

dialogues.speaker: ONE-EYED MERCHANT
dialogues.text: That’s not perfume, that’s goat piss! And I don’t know about any dagger. He shuffles off. Tamina turns angrily on Dastan.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: These merchants have all been leading you around like a fool!

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Thank you. How come you didn’t speak up before it was too late?

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Because I’m a mute, remember?  51. Dastan takes a whiff of the “perfume,” then tosses it awa in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: If we’re gonna find that dagger we need somebody who knows how to talk to these traders, somebody who really understands this world... He trails off as his eyes come to rest on.. FAROOD, in th center of a crowd, wheeling and dealing.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (walks over) Farood, my friend! I need your expertise...

dialogues.speaker: A GROUP OF NASAF SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: Bullying their way through the bazaar, questioning the merchants, who plead ignorance. Their leader is GARSIV. His keen eyes rove the crowd. A SOLDIER comes up to report.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: No sign of them by the river, sir.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Keep looking. He’s close. I can feel it. The Soldier salutes and takes off running. Garsiv turns to move on and bumps into a BOY in rags, knocking him down.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Watch where you’re going, boy. ANGLE ON THE BOY: TAMINA. A pair of hands swiftly pulls her clear of the soldiers’ feet.. Dastan averts his face as he leads her away. Garsiv turns and watches their departing backs suspicious Something familiar but.. he moves on to continue his sear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan and Tamina peer out.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: We have to leave at once.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Not without the dagger.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Forget the dagger. I don’t care about your magic relic.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Do you care about killing your brother and avenging your father’s death? (beat) You’1l need it.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (suspicious) For somebody who was trying to kill me not long ago, you suddenly seem awfully eager to help... She shrugs and looks down shyly... Just then a tap on his shoulder makes Dastan jump.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Ali, Bukbuk.. what are you doing here? I have found your dagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Soldiers of Nasaf have occupied the three-story home the wealthiest merchant in town. Nizam is sipping tea in the tiled courtyard when Garsiv tromps in after a fruitless day of searching.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: No luck today. But tomorrow--

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Tomorrow we make for Alamut.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: My lord, I believe Dastan is hiding in the wilderness nearby and that if we wait--  53.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: If he is hiding in the wilderness then he can do no further harm. He looks at Garsiv pointedly.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The personal animosity you bear toward Prince Dastan clouds your judgement, Captain Garsiv. Tomorrow we make for Alamut. Garsiv contains his frustration and bows his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farood leads Dastan and Tamina proudly toward an Inn.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: dealing with merchants requires subtlety, skill and years of experience honed in the bazaars from Bukhara to Baghdad. You couldn’t possibly be expected to master the art overnight, Ali. Given enough time however, I could teach you. Have you thought about my proposal? Dastan stares blankly for a moment. Then...

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Ah yes... your daughters. I can’t get them out of my head. But about that dagger...?

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: That was easy; the Innkeeper has it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An older female DANCER gyrates listlessly to the music pl on drums, tambourines and flutes. The tables are crowded with diverse travelers. Farood, Dastan and Tamina enter and make their way to..  54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LENK, the wizened Mongolian innkeeper makes notes in his ledger. Behind him is a middle-eastern pawn shop. The DAGGER sits prominently on a shelf. Dastan gestures to Farood and Tamina: “I’1l handle this.”

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Salaam Aleikum. I’m told you are not only an innkeeper but a trader of great renown. Lenk looks up slowly. Takes him in.

dialogues.speaker: LENK
dialogues.text: You have some worthless thing to sell?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Actually to buy. A mere trinket. A small dagger of purely sentimental value that I believe you.. ah, there it is. He points. Lenk picks up the dagger and examines it.

dialogues.speaker: LENK
dialogues.text: A trinket? This dagger has a gold hilt encrusted with rubies and sapphires. The edge is sharp enough to split hairs. And the workmanship is so fine it looks as if it were made by the gods.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (feigns disinterest) I’ve seen better... how much do you want for it? Lenk smirks, assuming Dastan doesn’t have a single dinar.

dialogues.speaker: LENK
dialogues.text: One hundred dinars.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Done. Quick as a flash, Dastan slaps a coin purse on the table.  55. Lenk stares. He picks up the purse. Its weight triggers n respect. Then... Farood jumps forward and grabs the purse.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Have you lost your mind? That’s no way to bargain! (to Lenk) Twenty dinars. Farood suddenly feels the purse and realizes...

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where did you get one hundred dinars? Before Dastan can reply, Lenk snatches the purse back.

dialogues.speaker: LENK
dialogues.text: The price has already been agreed.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Yes, the price has been agreed!

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Nobody pays the first price offered. (to Lenk) He is a beginner. Fifty dinars.

dialogues.speaker: LENK
dialogues.text: One hundred dinars.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: You are thief, not an innkeeper! Come, we’re leaving. Farood takes the purse, grabs Dastan and hustles him out.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE BACK ROOM
dialogues.text: Dastan stops Farood.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Farood, I want that dagger!

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Oh, he’1l come running after us and take the fifty dinars, wait and see.  56. Dastan whisks the purse from Farood and heads back.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, he must come to us! (shakes his head) It’s going to take some time to teach him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan hurries to the desk.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I accept. One hundred dinars. He puts the money in front of Lenk who, offended, doesn’t look up from his writing.

dialogues.speaker: LENK
dialogues.text: No deal.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: All right then, name your price.

dialogues.speaker: LENK
dialogues.text: There is no price! Am I a beggar to take insults from a gypsy? Dastan is at a loss. Now he’s completely screwed.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Suppose I ask you. Lenk’s pen freezes at the sound of the sweet, feminine vo He looks up to see where it came from... Tamina steps forward and removes her turban. Shakes loose her long dark hair. A beat. Lenk grins.

dialogues.speaker: LENK
dialogues.text: For you, the price is one hundred dinars... and one dance for my guests.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (instantly) Done. Tamina looks at him in shock and betrayal.  57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garsiv strides down the street with half a dozen soldiers He’s in a foul mood after his conversation with Nizam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan hovers outside a curtained doorway.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (guiltily) It must feel good to get out of those rags.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (coldly, from within) Go away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan pulls up an ottoman behind Farood’s. Farood glance at the dagger in Dastan’s belt.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: I don’t mean to be critical, Ali, but you got the worst of that bargain.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
