dialogues.text: (his eyes on the stage) Maybe not the absolute worst. Just then, the musicians strike up a rousing dance rhythm The customers lift their heads expectantly. The musicians continue... and continue. Still the stage remains empty. The BAND LEADER beckons furiously toward backstage; gives the crowd a phony smile. At that moment, the front door opens. Dastan turns to see GARSIV and SIX SOLDIERS enter with a blast of cold air fr outside. The soldiers take several tables, displacing the locals. Dastan turns pale. He wants to warn Tamina-- but there’s time. He settles for slouching down in his seat, out of Garsiv’s sight-line.  58. Farood notes Dastan’s reaction, realizing something is up

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: Tamina edges into view. She wears a veil and holds a scar in each hand, as is traditional in Mongolian yak-herding regions. She looks as if she wants to sink into the floor Someone backstage SHOVES her on -- she reacts angrily.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: winces. The crowd is starting to mutter. He glances nervously to see if Garsiv has noticed.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Far from suspicious, Garsiv seems perversely amused by th spectacle onstage. He turns to his LIEUTENANT.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Pretty girl. A pity she can’t dance.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Hiding behind Farood frantically gestures to Tamina to “dance.” She glares back at him. He demonstrates, showing her how she needs to move her hips.. then sees Farood loo at him.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (“grooving”) The music is good, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Ventures a timid dance step. The crowd BOOS. Someone thro a chicken bone at the stage. Dastan makes more emphatic “dance” gestures for Tamina be Farood’s back, indicating the soldiers with his eyes. Tamina looks. Registers Garsiv’s presence. Tamina’s expression changes. Glaring defiantly at Dastan, she shakes her booty in the manner he advised. The crowd HOOTS and applauds. The band leader, relieved, kicks the music up a notch. Tamina dances, with plenty of hip gyrations and scarf- twirling. Her eyes glint with cunning.  59. Garsiv is riveted. Dastan watches nervously as... Tamina dances off the stage, cutting a swath through the room, straight toward Dastan. All the time she keeps one on the soldiers. Alarmed, Dastan ducks under the table, baffling Farood.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I think I dropped some... Tamina pulls Dastan to his feet. She dances seductively around him. Her hands caress his body without actually touching. Her breath sears his cheek through the veil.

dialogues.speaker: THE NOMADS AND YAK HERDERS
dialogues.text: Stare open-mouthed. They’ve never seen anything like this The gypsy boy, his sight blocked by grownups, strains for better view. GARSIV speaks to his lieutenant without taking his eyes o Tamina:

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Whatever that girl costs -- pay it. TAMINA and DASTAN She’s outdoing herself, making Dastan the target of an er floor show that has riveted the whole room.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (hisses) That’s enough! Tamina keeps it up, smiling wickedly; she draws a gossame scarf across Dastan’s face. He’s sweating bullets. Before he’s quite realized what’s happening, she’s drawn DAGGER from his belt-- wrapping it in several turns of he scarf-- and is dancing away. Outraged, Dastan starts to go after her-- then stops. If pursues her he risks being recognized by Garsiv. Tamina dances back to the stage, having gotten what she wanted. But as she passes the table of soldiers... Her eyes briefly meet Garsiv’s through the veil. Is that lust or recognition in his stare?  60. Unnerved, Tamina hurries onto the stage. With a final flourish of scarves, she disappears through the curtain. The room ERUPTS. They'll be talking about this for months

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Glowering, jumps to his feet. He makes a beeline for the stage but his way is blocked by the crowd of Tamina’s admirers. Lenk patiently handles the crush of MERCHANTS a TRADERS thrusting coin purses at him. Dastan glances back across the room to the table where Ga was sitting. It’s empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina hurries down alleys, glancing over her shoulder. Mongolian MEN, loitering in groups in the darkness, notic

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Climbs onto a rooftop. Up a series of ladders, drainpipes and awnings until he has a vantage point of the surroundi streets and alleys. Nimble as a cat, he runs and jumps from one rooftop to th next, scanning all the while for a sign of..

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Rounds a corner and spots an unattended pony. She goes ov to untie the animal. She hears a footstep and turns...

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: steps into the light. His soldiers fan out in a semi-circ cutting off her escape.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: A magnificent dancer and a horse thief. You have so many talents, Slave-Girl. Tamina quietly hides the dagger in the small of her back.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: I will pay for the horse.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Yes, you will.  61. Garsiv nods to the soldiers who seize her roughly.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Watching from a rooftop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOLDIERS sweep through the gate on horseback. Garsiv dismounts and approaches one of the guards.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Where is Nizam?

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: Asleep, sir.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Send for him. He’ll want to be woken for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan paces back and forth, gripping his sword and mutte to himself. He draws a line in the dirt and starts making hash marks on either side to weigh pros and cons...

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (on the con side) «the place is well-guarded and you'd probably get yourself killed... (in the pro column) «She has that magic dagger... (con) «only because she stole it from you... (pro) wif you don’t rescue her, Garsiv will do with her as he pleases... That really burns him up. Farood comes up behind him.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: If you are finished drawing in the dirt, Ali of Samarkand, we are preparing to go. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (a beat) Where is your cousin? Dastan turns.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I have a confession to make, Farood. Bukbuk is not my cousin. Bukbuk is my.. fiancée. You see-- Farood holds up a hand.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: I make no judgements.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Bukbuk is the dancing girl. I mean, the dancing girl was Bukbuk.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: (confused) What...? (realizing) Oh... you mean...? (grinning) Oooooooh! Dastan nods, running with it.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Yes, my parents forbid the marriage on account of her being a heathen. So we fled in the middle of the night. Her father had us declared outlaws so the soldiers came after us. We only escaped by disguising ourselves. Then we met up with you... Now after all we’ve been through, she has been captured. Dastan wipes a fake tear from his eye. Farood puts a hand his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: What a tragic and romantic tale. I feel for you, Ali.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (quick) Then you will help me rescue her?

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Uh... why would I do that?  63.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Our of romantic spirit..? Friendship..? Goodwill...?

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Ah-ha, hah-ha, hah-ha! Dastan waits for him to stop laughing.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Okay. How much do you want?

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: (all business again) What do you have? Dastan produces a gold ring. Farood bites it: real gold.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You’re either a very rich student, Ali, or a very good thief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina stands in the center of the room, her wrists bound together. A pair of guards flank the door. Garsiv paces around her.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Where is Dastan?

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Why do you go on protecting him? He’s no longer a Prince. He’s nothing. Powerless.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Good. Then you shouldn’t need my help catching him. He circles closer to her, menacing.  64.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: You have a sharp tongue, Slave- Girl. I’1l need to cure it if I’m going to keep you. Garsiv snaps his fingers and a Guard hands him a ROPE. Tamina watches nervously as he knots it to her wrists, th throws the other end over a rafter. He pulls it tight unt her arms are stretched up and she’s forced onto her toes. She grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I‘ll give you a little time to get comfortable. If you’re still not cooperative when I get back, we'll play some other games... He ties the rope off to a cleat on the wall, then departs along with the guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pair of SOLDIERS guard the gate surrounding the compoun Farood approaches, a bottle in hand, weaving slightly.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Salaam aliekum. As he bows to the soldiers a pair of dice falls out of hi sleeve and rolls up to their feet.. their eyes meet.

dialogues.speaker: A FEW MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: As Farood plays dice and drinks with the guards... Dastan scales the wall in the background. He scampers ove and jumps to...

dialogues.speaker: A LARGE WALNUT TREE
dialogues.text: Dastan climbs up and out a limb toward the house.  65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina is tied up where Garsiv left her. She rubs and twi her wrists together in a desperate effort to fray the rop It’s no use. Suddenly a movement outside the window catches her eye. S turns and sees...

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: perched on a tree limb as far out as he can go. Tamina’s eyes light up with astonishment and hope. She ca believe he’s here. He puts his finger to his lips-- points down.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL MORE SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: Keeping watch around the house. Dastan assesses the situation: fifteen feet to the window-- too far to jump. ON TAMINA - she hears footsteps outside the door. She makes an impatient face at Dastan: “Get me out of her He holds up a finger: “Give me a second, I’m thinking!” Dastan stares through the open window at her bound wrists Gets an idea. He takes out a throwing knife (borrowed presumably) and starts flipping it in his hand. Looks at Tamina:

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (mouths silently) DON’T MOVE. Tamina sees what he’s planning.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: (mouths back)

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: He nods reassuringly: “I can do this.” She shakes her head emphatically: “No you can’t.” Ignoring her, Dastan braces himself and takes aim. She shakes her head furiously: NO!  66. Dastan cocks the knife: one, two, three... Just as he releases, a HISSING sound distracts Dastan: A LARGE SNAKE is coiling itself around the branch by his fe Dastan jerks. The knife flies through the window. Tamina closes her eyes as the knife sails past and... THWACK! It slices through the rope where it’s tied to the wall, causing it to go slack. Tamina opens her eyes in amazement and realizes her arms no longer held up. She yanks the rope from the rafter and runs to the window. She sees Dastan doing a curious dance the tree branch...

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispers loudly) Stop fooling around and catch this rope! Dastan looks up as Tamina throws the rope. The snake strikes: Dastan jumps. Catches the rope in mid-air... Tamina is yanked OUT the window by her bound wrists. They plummet toward the ground until... the rope catches on a branch: they bounce to a halt, ten feet above the ground. They swing back and forth for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (hissed whisper) You know, for a minute I thought you were actually going to try to cut my hands free with that knife throw... Dastan laughs nervously. Her eyes narrow: that’s exactly what he was trying to do.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You-- CRACK! The branch breaks sending them crashing to the ground. TWO SOLDIERS come running...  67.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: Who goes there? Dastan and Tamina pull the rope taught into a tripline an sweep the onrushing guards off their feet even as she continues to vent her fury.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you! The only reason you didn’t kill me is that you’re such a bad shot you didn’t come close! Dastan RAPS the soldiers’ heads together before they can up.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Is that your way of saying “thank you for rescuing me?” Tamina takes off running.. runs out of rope and comes cra to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wrong way. He reels her in. He pulls her close and wraps his arms around her. Her reaction is a mixture of outrage, surpris and maybe a little bit of excitement as Dastan runs his h down her body, searching... Got it! He pulls the DAGGER from behind her back. Cuts he wrists free in one motion and tucks the dagger into HIS belt.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garsiv leads Nizam (just dressed) up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: I tell you, my Lord, it’s the self- same girl... They arrive at the door to the chamber and Garsiv throws open. They enter and discover that it is.. empty. A beat.  68.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dastan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farood waits nervously with two camels. There’s a rustlin in the tree branches above and... Dastan drops down beside him. He reaches up to help Tamin who ignores him and jumps down on her own. Farood looks her over.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: I like you better as a woman, Bukbuk. One thing I don’t understand... are you still a mute? Before she can respond they HEAR SHOUTS of ALARM raised within. Farood hands them both full length BURKHAS. They throw them on and mount the camels. Farood sets off with his two “WOMEN” behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nomad caravan is waking up. TAMINA (dressed as a shepherd again) crawls out of her bedroll and spots Dastan sitting alone, stoking the fire. She goes over and joins him.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (glances up) Ah, good morning Princess Bukbuk.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Good morning, Prince Ali. Until you came back to rescue me yesterday I wasn’t sure you really were the son of a king. He looks at her to see if she’s teasing him. She’s not.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your father would have been proud.  69.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I missed my chance to make him proud while he lived. I played the fool, wasted my time in amusements... Now it is too late. He looks down bitterly.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: You can still avenge his death with a noble act. Your brother Tus, who brutally crushes my people--

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: My brother is a good man. I still can’t believe he killed our father. Tamina’s temper flashes.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: A good man? He invaded our peaceful kingdom for loot!

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: That’s not true. Tus only ordered the attack because your “peaceful” kingdom was secretly supplying our enemy.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Lies!

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I was there when the spy confessed!

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: You heard this confession yourself?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Yes. Well... not exactly. Nizam translated it for us.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: (beat) Nizam is the graybeard with two swords?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Yes.  70. ON TAMINA, her mind racing.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. PALACE OF NASAF, HALLWAY —- FLASHBACK Tamina flees the kitchen and moves down the corridor. She approaches the door that is ajar to peek inside... TAMINA’S POV - Nizam pours POISON on the ROBE OF HONOR. He looks up and sees Tamina.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? Somebody grab that girl! Tamina turns and flees.

dialogues.speaker: ON DASTAN
dialogues.text: Shocked by her revelation.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: It was Nizam..? (beat) Yet you encouraged me to kill my brother.. knowing he was innocent?! Tamina doesn’t back down.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Not innocent: he invaded and destroyed my home. Or so I believed. Now I have told you the truth. Her eyes bore into him.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Even if Nizam deceived you, you and your brothers have done a grave injustice to my people. It is your duty to make it right. Dastan looks back at her warily.  71.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: When we get to Alamut, you will help me reach my brother. We will tell him all that has happened. He will decide what to do. Dastan stands and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nizam, Garsiv and their regiment ride in through the gate Tus awaits them, trembling with emotion. Nizam dismounts, his expression sorrowful and compassionate.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: Nizam, tell me it’s not true. My brother did not kill our father.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Nor would I believe it, had I not seen it with my own eyes. Would that I had died rather than live to witness such a deed... my King. Nizam prostrates himself before Tus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The nomad caravan struggles uphill against freezing wind snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MASSIVE EXCAVATION PROJECT is under way in the main courtyard. HUNDREDS of SLAVES overseen by soldiers dig a at the entrance of the temple, where the SACRED FOUNTAIN shattered into pieces. REVEAL NIZAM and GARSIV Surveying the excavation from a battlement.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: King Tus is eager to return to Nasaf, my Lord. Why do you persist in this fruitless search for secret armories?  72.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: I do not seek armories, Garsiv. There is more here than you know. Nor need to know.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: So long as I am to be made general of the armies, I care not. But I am anxious about Dastan and the girl. If they were to reach the King...

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: (cuts him off) Then remain vigilant. Make sure that never happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Occupied by the Persian army, the citadel of Alamut stand exposed in broad daylight and shorn of its mystery. Soldiers stationed at the entrance do a thorough job of checking everyone who goes in or out. Farood and his noma wait on the bridge for their turn.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: We who have crossed the Hindu Kush and endured every hardship of God’s creation-- now we wait. Dastan and Tamina exchange a nervous glance: getting into city could be the toughest part of all.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Farood, there’s something more I have to tell you. I’m not really--

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Nonsense. You have nothing to tell me. Ali, my friend, I have been thinking of the tale of Layla and Majnun -- the young scholar who abducted his beloved from her husband's home.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (perplexed) He did not abduct her. Majnun spent his life pining for Layla and died a wanderer in the desert.  73.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Ah well, you are more educated than I. In the version I heard, they escaped together -- under the noses of her husband’s men.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: How did they do that?

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: His friends created a disturbance while the lovers slipped through the gates. Dastan glances at the checkpoint. Their turn is coming up

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ali, I am not a man to pry into matters that do not concern me. But I advise you to consider my version of the story. (into Dastan’s ear) Anyway, do you really think I would let my daughters marry such a man-- a womanizer with no respect for the law? Before Dastan can reply, Farood hurries to intercept a Soldier who is just lifting the tarp covering the wagon:

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah ha! Please! You may search me, and every member of my tribe-- but to search that wagon is a waste of time.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Stand back. The soldiers restrain Farood, who becomes agitated.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Why do you not search the camels and the mules? Why this absurd fascination with that cart? Take your hands off me! All the soldiers come rushing over to contain the situati Dastan nudges Tamina. They edge around the commotion whil Farood continues to struggle and make a fuss.  74. The soldiers slash at the tarp and rip it from the cart. CHICKENS FLY OUT into their faces. The nomads race to cat the escaping poultry.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now who will compensate me for my chickens? In God's name, tie the cloth before they all escape! Dastan sees the gypsy boy watching him. He winks and wave good-bye, and slips through the gate with Tamina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina rips off the turban and ties her hair in the more feminine, local fashion. Hiding behind a low wall, they watch the excavation -- Dastan curious, Tamina horrified.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: They've defiled the temple and destroyed the sacred fountain. Dastan spots Nizam, overseeing the excavation.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: What is Nizam up to?

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: He knows.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: He knows what? She turns away, thinking her own thoughts. Dastan takes h by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want revenge for what Nizam has done to your temple? To your people? (forces her to look the slaves digging) I want revenge for my father. We can work together. But you need to tell me the truth. What’s under that temple?

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: (hesitates) Come with me.  75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina pulls him into the shadows and starts to speak in hushed, otherworldly voice.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: ‘The sun god looked down and saw the wickedness of man, and the light became darkness in his sight. He sent a great sand storm to destroy every living thing, wipe clean the face of the earth.’ Dastan shivers, spooked by her trancelike recitation... Her words She gives

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ‘But the Great Mother said to the sun god: “Who are you to destroy my creation?” And she blew the sands into an Hourglass so strong no sword nor spear could break it. And thus she spoke: “These are the Sands of Time. As you decreed, all that lives shall die-- but not at once. Rather day by day, hour by hour, as the sand flows through the hourglass, so shall life slip away from all my children. When it is empty, then and only then shall the face of the earth be cold and dead forevermore.”’ die into reverential silence-- which Dastan breaks.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: First of all, there is only one God. Second, the way I heard it, it was a flood, not a sand storm. him a withering look.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: For ten thousand years the hourglass holding the Sands of Time has rested here in Alamut, below the temple. They are the time of all mankind. The dagger is the key -- the only key, entrusted to us by the gods to protect them. It is the only blade that can break the glass.  76. Dastan glances down at the dagger with newfound respect.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: So Nizam is after the hourglass, but he needs the dagger as well.. he must not realize it was ever taken away.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: (nods ) This changes everything. It was a mistake to come back here. We can’t let the dagger fall into Nizam’s hands.. We should flee.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: And leave your people enslaved? And my father’s death unavenged? (shakes his head) I may only be a fourth son, but my father was still a king. As was yours. We can’t give up that easily. Tamina meets his gaze. Sees his determination and it give her hope... a look of resolve appears in her eyes. She no

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan follows Tamina, weaving through alleys and back wa

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: The dagger holds only a minute’s worth of sand. Once we refill it, we'll have only one chance to use it to reach your brother. You are certain he will listen to you?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: When I was ten, my father bought a stallion so wild, none of our warriors dared ride it. I was sure I could. (beat) The warriors were right. It was Tus who jumped into the ring. Pulled me out from under the stamping hooves before they crushed my skull. He broke an arm and two ribs; I got off with a few scratches. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Since then we’ve had our differences... but he’d still give his life for me, and I for him. Tamina holds up a hand and stops him as she waits for a t of Nasaf soldiers to pass by in the street. She turns and faces him.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I give you my word that my brother is an honorable man. When he learns the truth, our army will leave your city and Nizam will answer for his treason.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: (studies him) I will have to trust you. (beat) And you will have to trust me. Give me the dagger. He hesitates, looking at her questioningly.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There is a secret path to the hourglass but it can only be opened by the High Priestess. And she must do it alone...

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (realizing) You’re the High Priestess?

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: I’1ll come back for you afterwards. I promise. She holds out her hand. Is this a trick? Dastan looks int her eyes... Slowly, he places the dagger in her hand -- their fingers touch and linger a beat longer than absolutely necessary. Then she’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pickaxes swing rhythmically, chopping at the ancient ston overseers crack their whips.. Through it all strides Niza  78.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Tell them if they don’t break through by nightfall, their wives and children will dig in their place!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina walks to a distant corner of the ancient wall. Nob is around. She locates a brick with a faded image of a li carved on it and a barely noticeable INDENTATION in the s of a diamond. Tamina mutters the words of an ancient incantation IN FOREIGN, then places the hilt of the dagger into the indentation.. it fits perfectly. CLICK. A beat. Then a deep grinding sound as a secret door in th wall slides open, revealing a narrow staircase descending into darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan waits, growing increasingly anxious with every pas moment. He doesn’t like staying in one place this long.

dialogues.speaker: ON TAMINA
dialogues.text: hurrying back to retrieve Dastan.

dialogues.speaker: A PATROL OF SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: passes the far end of the alley where Dastan hides. A SOLDIER glances over just as a shaft of light illuminates Dastan’s profile. The Soldier does a double take and whistles for his fellows to halt.

dialogues.speaker: ON DASTAN
dialogues.text: waiting, unsuspecting. The SOLDIERS ambush him without warning. He fights furiously but he doesn’t stand a chanc

dialogues.speaker: ON TAMINA
dialogues.text: finally returning. She sees the commotion in the mouth of the alleyway and ducks into a doorway to watch. Her face falls as she sees Dastan being dragged away.  79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MESSENGER comes running up to Garsiv.

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: Sir! Prince Dastan has been captured!

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Dastan? Are you sure it’s him? Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: MESSENGER
dialogues.text: Here in Alamut, sir. He’s been taken to the dungeon. Garsiv sets off immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW A RAT scurrying across the dank dungeon floor to..

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN,
dialogues.text: complaining through the bars of his cell to a sleepy, dru PRISONER in the adjoining cell.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: «I’m telling you, never trust a woman. As the Poet says: “The only time a woman tells the truth is when she is silent.” A hunched old JAILOR in a hooded shawl approaches, doling gruel to the prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And another thing-- the more beautiful her face, the better she lies. It is a proven fact..

dialogues.speaker: JAILOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Should I take that as a compliment? The “JAILOR” throws back the hood and reveals herself to TAMINA. Dastan stares in shock for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: You! ..I thought you’d sold me out!  80.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Is that your way of saying ‘thank you for rescuing me?’ She hands him his sword and pulls out a set of keys.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: How did you...?

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Your army may occupy the city, but my people still run everything. She unlocks the door and they hurry for the exit. Dastan suddenly stops and doubles back for second:

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (to the drunk prisoner) Forget everything I said before. And hurries after Tamina. Just as the door shuts behind t The door at the far end of the room opens and... GARSIV enters attended by soldiers. They head for Dastan’ (empty) cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina hands the keys back to the real Alamut JAILOR and thanks him IN FOREIGN. The MAN bows deeply and kisses her hand. She and Dastan flee into the city.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (re: the Jailor) I guess you really are the Princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garsiv stares in rage at the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan and Tamina look back and see SOLDIERS pouring out the streets.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Follow me. Tamina takes Dastan by the hand and they run through the streets of the old city. EXT. MARKETPLACE — DAY A crowded, bustling SOUK. Tamina and Dastan try to lose themselves among the vendors and carts. But patrols of SOLDIERS begin entering from every directi

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: We're trapped. They’ve got all the exits covered.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: There’s a storm drain leading out below. Maybe it’s not guarded. Again Dastan follows, ducking down and hiding in the crow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The din of the market fades as Tamina and Dastan slip int the dark tunnel. Nobody there. It looks like maybe they’v escaped. Until they emerge on the other side and find... A PATROL of A DOZEN NASAF SOLDIERS. Dastan draws his swor MAN’S VOICE (0.S.) Put away your sword. Dastan turns and sees.. the BRUTISH SOLDIER he let keep t dagger in the opening scene. He approaches and looms over Dastan.

dialogues.speaker: BRUTISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Dastan is a great Prince of Nasaf. I know him personally. He wears only the finest clothes and armor. Jewels and gold. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: BRUTISH SOLDIER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (scornful) This man is clearly no prince. Let them go. One brave SOLDIER steps forward to object.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER
dialogues.text: But what if--

dialogues.speaker: BRUTISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: I said: let them go. The soldier steps back, cowed. Dastan and the brute excha a brief glance. Dastan nods: the debt is squared.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. SECRET ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Tamina leads Dastan to the doorway. They step inside and start down the stairs... The stairs end. Tamina lights a TORCH. The flames illuminate a musty passageway, clearly ancient. Hushed, echoing. An underground RIVER flows somewhere out of sigh Tamina recites a prayer in ancient FOREIGN, praising the and asking permission to enter. Dastan shifts uncomfortab and looks elsewhere. Carved into the stone wall is an enormous LION FACE, primitive and terrifying. Dastan peers closer. Tamina yan him back.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: This isn’t a game. This place is sacred. There’s a ritual for how you approach it. The sun god will be angry if we don’t show respect.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Your sun god is a lion? (off her exasperated look) All right! I’11 just follow you. As they pass the lion, Tamina gives it a wide berth, all while uttering respectful prayers and making little bows toward it. Dastan rolls his eyes, and half-heartedly foll suit. Tamina’s torch illuminates the stone floor as they go. Sh grabs Dastan to stop him from stepping in a certain place  83.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Do you see that black paving-stone? Dastan looks closely; he can make out a few flakes of wha might have been black paint, a thousand years ago.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t call it black. Maybe it’s a little bit darker than the others.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: We’re in the sun god’s temple. The black stones represent man’s wickedness, the greed and selfishness that brought the sandstorm on us. We don’t step on the black stones.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: All right, look. I don’t want to disrespect your religion. It’s just that we may not have time to follow every little superstition...

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Dastan! Her eyes flash dangerously. Dastan backs down.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: All right. No black stones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nizam turns from the dig as Garsiv strides to meet him.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: My lord. Dastan is in Alamut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina and Dastan come to a halt at the edge of a water- filled chasm where a rope bridge used to be. Remnants of rope dangle uselessly from either side. The rock wall has partially collapsed, smashing the bridge and flooding the chasm with water.  84.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: (dismayed) They must have weakened that wall with their digging. Now we can’t get across. Dastan’s eyes rove the far wall.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I think I can.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: How? Dastan backs up for a running start. Tamina grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t be a fool. You can’t jump that far.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I know that. I’m not crazy. He sprints toward the edge... but instead of jumping the he RUNS ALONG THE WALL for a good 20 feet.. until gravity catches up with him, his feet slip-slide and he starts to fall. Dastan PUSHES OFF THE WALL with his feet, propelling hims across the gap -- GRABS a crevice in the rock wall opposi barely saving himself from the plunge -- -- as SPIKES spring up below, breaking the surface of the muddy water covering the bottom of the pit. Tamina gasps. Dastan begins to rock-climb across the wall, using the mo miniscule hand and footholds. He nearly falls -- more spi spring up below -- but he hangs on, keeps going. Tamina watches, holding her breath. At last Dastan reaches the far wall. It’s sheer, not a handhold in sight. He gropes for one anyway. His hand SLI on the slick rock. Tamina can’t look... The chasm is too wide at this end for Dastan to jump back the opposite wall. Nevertheless, he braces his feet again the rock -- and LAUNCHES himself out into space.  85. Sailing over the pit.. he GRABS the end of the broken rop bridge as he falls past it. Hangs on, twisting and dangli It holds. Dastan climbs up the rope bridge to safety. Brushes himse off, shouts reproachfully at Tamina across the chasm--

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You could have warned me about the spikes!

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: How do I get across? Dastan looks around. There’s no way.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: We'll figure something out.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: No. You’re almost there. (she takes out the dagger) In the top of the hourglass is all time yet to come. In the bottom is time past. Between the two, it narrows to the width of a single moment: the Now. That is where you must insert the dagger’s handle. She tosses the dagger across the chasm. Dastan catches it

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hold the dagger by the blade. The handle will catch the sand as it falls. This is important: the blade must never touch the hourglass. Their eyes meet across the chasm. Both acknowledging the trust she’s placed in him.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Just make sure you’re here when I get back. He disappears. Tamina watches him go.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Watch out for the black stones!  86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan threads his way through a narrow corridor, steppin over the occasional black tile. With each step he takes, nothing happens and he grows more confident. He comes to another stone LION like the first. Sighing, h does as Tamina did, placing his back against the opposite wall.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Lion, I cannot bow down before you for no one deserves worship but God. But I do respect you, as a lion -- and I ask you not to bite me. Pleased with this compromise, Dastan passes the lion. And catches himself just about to step on a faded, black- painted stone. Looking ahead he realizes that half the paving stones in corridor ahead of him are black.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (sighs) God forgive me -- but she believes in it so what am I to do? With a martyred air, he hop-scotches down the corridor, f one safe stone to the next, until he reaches the alcove a the passageway’s midpoint. As he pauses to take a breather, Dastan’s eye is drawn to MURAL depicting the LEGEND: an angry sun god with a lion’ head, a blinding sandstorm, the hourglass... Dastan gazes in awe, experiencing the full religious impa Maybe there’s more to this than he thought... Dastan takes a deep breath and looks ahead; the second ha of the passageway is filled with even more black stones. Carefully, he hops between the increasingly scarce safe stones. To avoid getting stranded, he’s forced to start using the walls, clinging to them like a rockclimber. At last, the end of the black tiles comes into sight. Gritting his teeth, he PUSHES off the wall with his feet, JUMPS through the air, straining for distance--  87. He’s not going to make it. Switching his landing to a div at the last instant, he hits the floor with both hands instead of his feet, tumbles-- and clears it! Exhaling with relief, he gets to his feet... And hears an ominous “snick” he’s never heard before. Looking down he sees he’s standing right on a BLACK STONE He looks around for bad consequences. Doesn’t see any.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry lion. THWIPP!! A SCYTHE comes swinging down from the ceiling behind him. Dastan jumps ASIDE, barely escaping being bisected vertically -- only to land on another black ston FWIPP! A HORIZONTAL SCYTHE whips out from the wall at kne level. The blade just misses him as he JUMPS BACK -- Triggering TWO MORE HORIZONTAL SCYTHES on the opposite wa one at neck level, one waist-high. He escapes both by

dialogues.speaker: THROWING HIMSELF FLAT--
dialogues.text: -- Lands face down, only to hear the telltale “snick” of weight depressing yet another black stone. Uh-oh... Dastan ROLLS out of the way of one VERTICAL SCYTHE that w out of the floor -- lifts his legs just in time to escape castration by ANOTHER -- and SOMERSAULTS past a third. He lands in a crouch, looking around in wild terror. Miraculously, he’s survived it all.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (very fast, heartfelt) There is no god but God, the Almighty, all-compassionate and all- merciful. Praise be to God; You alone do we worship; Guide us on the straight path; Amen. (quick afterthought) And no disrespect to the Lion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan advances into the silent, natural cavern. A waterfall cascades down a sheer rock face into the dark of an abyss. We HEAR an underground river rushing far bel  88. Towering at the edge of the abyss is a titanic HOURGLASS. seems to have grown out of the rock itself. It holds thousands of tons of glowing white sand that bathe the chamber in an eerie light. Fascinated, Dastan approaches. He stares at the sand; thousands of millions of years worth of time -- no way to fathom it. He looks up at an ascending set of stairs carved into the stone, leading to a rock promontory at the neck of the hourglass... He begins to climb the stairs. At the top is a flat outcropping of rock. Above him looms the gigantic upper h of the hourglass, a vast reservoir of glowing sand. Dastan lies down and belly crawls until his head and shoulders are over the edge of the abyss and he can reach neck of the hourglass. He draws the dagger. Holding it as Tamina instructed, by blade, he brings its handle to within an inch of the glas

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: God is great. Bismillah. He pushes the dagger forward, with no idea what will happ The dagger’s handle penetrates the thick glass, instantly rendered liquid as quicksilver. Dastan’s so startled he jerks it right back out again -- rendering the glass once more miraculously intact. Deliberately, Dastan repeats the action. This time, he ho the dagger inside the hourglass, to catch the falling san Slowly, before his eyes, the glass handle starts to fill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pick-axe breaks through the rock shelf, triggering a landslide beneath the diggers’ feet. With SHOUTS of alarm they slide toward the bottom; their fellow diggers catch them, hanging on for dear life, and pull them to safety.  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina is startled to see new CRACKS suddenly appear in t rock wall above the chasm. WATER trickles through, suggesting a significant pressure build-up on the other s Tamina backs away... The water BURSTS part of the wall, pours through in a torrent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan realizes he’s been holding his breath. With a gasp he pulls the dagger back. It’s full of glowing sand. The hourglass is as solid as if it had never been touched

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan hop-scothes back through the corridor, nimbly avoi the black stones. Until, hurrying past the stone lion, he forgets to hug th opposite wall. Serrated IRON JAWS swing out from the horizontal slit of the lion’s mouth. Dastan hurdles over jaws as they crunch together like a giant bear-trap. As Dastan runs, the corridor floor COLLAPSES under him. Desperately he increases his speed. He can already see th broken bridge ahead. In a few more strides, there’1ll be floor left to run on. He makes a heroic RUNNING JUMP-- «out into space, above the yawning chasm where the floor in... «And falls short. He can’t believe it. After everything h been through, this is how it ends -- plunging toward cert death on JAGGED SPIKES below! As he’s about to be impaled, he snatches the dagger from sheath -- BOOM!! TIME STOPS -- the spikes inches from Dastan’s ches the entire scene frozen except for the SAND spilling from dagger in Dastan’s hand... his finger on the jewel. The s blows away like ash in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIME RUNS BACKWARD. Dastan flies up away from the spikes, the corridor floor reassembling under his feet as he runs backwards, JUMPS backward over the lion-jaws as they open Until his hand releases the jewel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time, Dastan runs to one side as he passes the lion jaws. And he’s through, safely skirting all the traps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WATER GUSHES IN, swelling the already flooded pit.. while cracks pop up everywhere in the stressed rock wall. Tamin sees Dastan appear on the far side of the chasm.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: It’s collapsing! Dastan surveys the scene. He sees that the rock wall is a DAM ready to BURST-- Suddenly the edge where Tamina is standing COLLAPSES! She falls into the water. Without hesitation, Dastan dives into the chasm and start swimming across, dodging falling rocks and swirling curre Tamina sees Dastan go under.. she looks around desperatel Dastan surfaces right in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Take a deep breath. He grabs Tamina and pulls her down into the water. THE DAM BURSTS! The wall caves in, a THUNDER OF ROCK and WATER are unleashed. UNDERWATER: The explosive current propels Dastan and Tami through a stone-walled channel -- Dastan takes Tamina’s h kicks upward toward the LIGHT --  91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan and Tamina surface in the river, below the citadel wall. They gasp for air. As soon as they catch their breath...

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: You used the dagger, didn’t you! Battered, half-dead with exhaustion, Dastan hoists himsel onto the embankment. He reaches to help Tamina up. Angril she shakes him off.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One minute. We have one minute of sand to get to your brother and you've already used half of it! Dastan looks at the dagger -- it’s half empty.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I didn’t think I used that much. Just then, he dodges instinctively as an ARROW misses his head by inches, imbeds in the wall behind him. Defensivel before Tamina can accuse him--

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It missed by itself. ARCHERS assemble on the ramparts above. Dastan and Tamina race up the stone steps of the embankment.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: I just had the strangest feeling we've done this before... Dastan suddenly grabs her, yanks her back.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Wait. In the next instant, a volley of ARROWS shoot past right front of Tamina. Dastan releases her.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now.  92. As they continue their dash up the stairs--

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: You did it again, didn’t you!?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: That time I did. Trust me, you weren’t any happier the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The majestic hourglass sits in silent darkness. Suddenly, a PICK breaks through the roof. A shaft of sunlight illuminates the chamber that has been dark for centuries. Shouts of excitement from the workers above. More picks c at the hole, raining down rocks and debris. THE HOURGLASS: as the rocks strike its surface, it begins resonate like a great warning bell... EXT. EXCAVATION PIT —- SAME Drawn by the sound, Nizam moves down toward the hole.. hi eyes light up as he finally glimpses the prize below.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Magnificent... (turns to a FOREMAN) Have them search every chamber. When they find a dagger with a clear handle, have it brought directly to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina takes Dastan’s arm, points to the ROYAL PALACE standing on the other side of a deep mountain gorge. A narrow stone bridge below is the only way across the chas

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: That’s the palace just across that bridge. I know a place-- Dastan tackles her to the ground as a SPEAR hurtles throu the space where they were just standing.  93.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (not without pride) God, our soldiers are good! Tamina looks, sees-— A DOZEN SOLDIERS running toward them across the rooftops. More on their way, throwing up ladders as they climb. Dastan yanks Tamina to her feet. With the army on their heels, they improvise a rapid descent via stairs, ladders free-fall to the bridge level. As they climb down the final ladder (Tamina first), more soldiers run toward them from the bridge. Dastan and Tami are trapped between the new arrivals and the soldiers abo Dastan reaches for the DAGGER. Tamina stops him.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: No. Dastan grits his teeth. All right, he’1l do it the hard w He PUSHES OFF the wall with the ladder, LANDS in a judo r that FLIPS the ladder over him-- tossing Tamina over the heads of the soldiers in front of them. Dastan continues momentum, POLE-VAULTING over Tamina on the ladder. This master-stroke puts all the soldiers behind them, leaving a clear path to the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan and Tamina make a mad dash across the bridge. They more than halfway there when MORE SOLDIERS appear on the side, led by Garsiv. Dastan comes to a skidding stop. He looks back: they’re trapped on a long, narrow stone bridge between two armies, above a vertigo-inducing ravin plunging ten thousand feet below.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Should have used the dagger. With a communal ROAR, the soldiers charge from both sides Dastan swings into action. Snatching up a rope coil, he swiftly ties it around a parapet of the bridge wall...  94. «and draws his sword as the soldiers descend on them. Hopelessly outnumbered, Dastan and Tamina leap onto the bridge wall and run BACK the way they came-- Dastan parry sword blows and uncoiling rope as he runs.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: You can’t possibly--

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Hold tight. Tamina locks her arms around Dastan just in time -- he JU

dialogues.speaker: THEY PLUMMET ON THE ROPE TOWARDS THE BOTTOMLESS GORGE
dialogues.text: The rope stops their fall; they start swinging back towar the far side of the bridge-- incredibly, straight for a t ARCHER'S LOOPHOLE in the sheer fortress wall opposite. Dastan’s aim was brilliant. But not perfect. They slam into the wall below the loophole. It’s just out their reach. As they start swinging back--

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Climb higher! We’1ll make it on the next swing! Tamina and Dastan desperately climb up a few feet on the rope. ARCHERS on the bridge above them unleash a volley o arrows, which miss, but don’t make their task any easier. They reach the apex of their backswing, begin their retur toward the loophole.. Dastan reaches out to grab it-- Only this time, they don’t even reach the wall. They’ve l too much momentum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan and Tamina swing uselessly back and forth, in a smaller arc each time. They’re trapped at the end of the rope. Hanging off a bridge that’s full of soldiers. Oops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A soldier (call him the EXECUTIONER) mounts the parapet w Dastan tied the rope. He draws a wicked scimitar. Checks with Garsiv, who nods: do it. The Executioner raises his sword high-- and CHOPS! DASTAN and TAMINA are shaken. One more cut will sever the rope.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: All right. Use the dagger.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Oh I don’t know, I think we can get out of this one.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Use the dagger! NOW!! The Executioner raises his scimitar for the coup de grace Dastan releases one hand from the rope, uses it to pull Tamina toward him and gives her a passionate kiss. The sword cuts the rope: Dastan and Tamina plunge into th abyss... then Dastan HITS the jewel.

dialogues.speaker: REWIND
dialogues.text: Reversing through the kiss, and all their back-and-forth swings, wider each time, until they land back up on--

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Hold tight. Exactly as before, Tamina locks her arms around Dastan as JUMPS from the parapet. Only this time, he adjusts his aim, hastily CLIMBING the as they swing.. hits the loophole, grabs and pulls them i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garsiv stares down into the gorge, dumbfounded, at the em rope swinging below the bridge. They’ve escaped him.  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina and Dastan land together on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: That was fantastic! Dastan sits up and stares at her with a goofy grin, still mesmerized from their kiss...

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Dastan! Did you use the dagger?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: What? No! Of course not... She examines his face but he doesn’t break. No time for further discussion. She sets off down the hall and he hurries after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race up stairs, through corridors, etc. Soldiers’ voices echo, seemingly around every corner, but they see nobody.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: I hope you know where you’re going. Tamina throws open the small wooden door of a supply clos they duck inside. She closes the door, plunging them into darkness. WE HEAR their breathing, rapid and shallow.. then the cli a hidden latch and another door swings open--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina lights a lantern revealing a cozy room, rich with curtains and draperies, a tea service and silk cushions.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: A secret getaway...?

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: For the king. I was a nosy little girl, always getting into places I wasn’t supposed to...  97. She parts a curtain, revealing a short passageway that de ends in a door. Tamina slides open a peephole and looks..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Servants fill the royal baths with hot water. Tamina step aside to let Dastan look.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The King’s private bath. They’re preparing it for him now. When your brother returns, you’ll have a chance to speak to him alone. She walks back into the secret room. Dastan follows. He opens the shutter to look out the small window... On the stone bridge far below he sees dozens of soldiers running around searching for the escaped fugitives. Dastan turns to see Tamina step out from behind a folding screen, having changed into a gorgeous silk gown. He stares, stunned. Tamina looks down.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What? You don’t like it? I had to get out of those rags...

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: No, no, I like it.. it’s just... you look beautiful. He takes a step closer. Her face bathed in the warm light exquisite.. her skin flawless.. he looks into her dark ey and.. kisses her full on the mouth. Except this time there is no rewind. He catches himself, waiting for her to slap him. but instead, Tamina responds She kisses him deeply in return, giving into the moment, pressing against him. their pent-up attraction is release and their embrace becomes more and more passionate until- Tamina suddenly pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Stop. This can never be.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: What? What can never be?  98.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Us. You and me.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Why not? I mean, assuming I convince my brother, restore your kingdom and all that stuff... why not? (suddenly defensive) It’s because I’m only a fourth son, isn’t it? She shakes her head sadly and looks toward the window.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: I don’t care about that. It’s because I’m the High Priestess. I can only marry one who has been baptized in the sacred fountain.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Is that all? I told you I’m a very modern thinker; if it’s that important to you I’1l take a dip--

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: You can’t! Nobody can, ever again. The fountain has been destroyed. A beat. Tamina looks at him wistfully.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Dastan. It’s not meant to be between us. Dastan searches for the right words to say when... A HORN BLAST outside signals the king’s arrival. They bot hurry to the window in time to see: TUS and a half-dozen GUARDS ride across the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: My brother.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: You'd best prepare yourself. You cannot fail.  99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tus and his bodyguards stride across the great hall. A YO GUARD steps forward and bows.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: My King. Nizam sends word that he would speak with you.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: I’ve been riding all day. I’11 see him after I’ve bathed and changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEAM fills the room. The King’s guards watch the ATTENDA prepare the bath in a centuries-old Eastern ritual.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE SECRET ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Dastan watches through the peephole, rehearsing nervously under his breath.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: ‘It was not I who killed our father.’ Can’t start with that. ‘My brother, it is I, Dastan. I come to you in peace...’ No time for that; get to the point! ‘My brother...’ That’s a good start. DASTAN’S POV - the guards escort the attendants out. Mome later, Tus enters. The guards leave him alone to his bath

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ‘My brother...’ ‘My noble brother...’ Dastan turns and locks eyes with Tamina one last time; sh gives him an encouraging nod.. Dastan presses on the door

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BATHS
dialogues.text: The secret door, invisible in the tiled wall, opens. Dast steps through silently and disappears into the steam. TUS takes off his robe and lowers himself into the steami water. Rinses his face and hair and sinks down. He closes his eyes... Suddenly he feels a draft. Frowns. Opens his eyes...  100.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My noble brother. Tus splashes to his feet, waist-high in the water.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: GUARDS
dialogues.text: Dastan throws his sword aside. Holds up his hands-- unarm

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: You have nothing to fear from me. What Nizam told you is a lie. He killed Father. It was Nizam who poisoned the robe. The GUARDS burst in and seize Dastan

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tus, Nizam deceived us all. He made us conquer Alamut so he could possess its secrets! And if you try to stop him, he will kill you too!

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: Enough! ! Everyone falls silent. Dastan ceases struggling and waits suspense for Tus’s next words.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: We are brothers. Since childhood I’ve known you as I know myself. I can tell by how artfully you’ve rehearsed your speech that you are lying. (to the guards) Take him to Nizam. ANGLE ON TAMINA - watching through the peephole, dismayed Tus turns away as the guards drag Dastan off.  101.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: No! Tus, listen to me, I’m not making this up! TUS!! Tus never looks back. Dastan appeals to the guards:

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I beg you. One minute. Let me speak to him. As you love him, as you loved your king-- The CAPTAIN of the guards punches him in the head.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: Shut up, you. Now Dastan’s mad. With a herculean effort, he yanks free, just enough to draw the dagger from his belt--

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: He’s got a knife. --and hits the JEWEL. BOOM!! TIME STANDS STILL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tus takes off his robe, lowers himself into the steaming bath. Rinses his face and hair, just as he did before. A NOISE makes Tus turn. Dastan has just BARRICADED the do with a medieval two-by-four. Tus splashes to his feet. Th time, the first thing Dastan does is throw his sword away

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Tus, don’t call the guards yet. Listen to me.

dialogues.speaker: GUARDS
dialogues.text: Dastan winces; continues, improvising...

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Beneath this citadel is an ancient, mystical force beyond anything you can imagine. It’s the hourglass that contains the Sands of Time. SOUNDS of the guards beating at the barricaded door--  102.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This dagger holds only a minute’s worth of the sand. He draws the dagger, forgetting it’s a weapon too--

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: Coward! Do you attack me thus, unarmed?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: No! Hastily turning the dagger around-- this isn’t going well

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nizam is after the hourglass and the dagger. He tricked us into falsely invading a kingdom that has done us no wrong. To hide his lies, he murdered our father and threw the blame on me. The door gives way; the guards burst in. Dastan doesn’t h to wait for Tus’s verdict to know he’s blown it.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (angry with himself) Damn it! He jumps back, using the dagger to hold the guards at bay

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stand back! I warn you! The guards hesitate, perplexed. In a second they'll reali there’s no real threat and rush him.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need a minute. Just give me a minute to think. He looks at the dagger in his hand -- nearly empty. Just enough sand for one last rewind. Suddenly, desperately, he looks at Tus. He knows what to

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tus, this is no ordinary dagger. Touch this jewel on its handle and you will learn Alamut’s greatest secret.  103.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: (to the guards) Enough! Take him to Nizam. As the guards move forward, Dastan swiftly brings the dagger’s blade to his own throat. Again, they hesitate.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (to Tus) If you won’t believe me, then our kingdom is forfeit. Our honor is forfeit. And I’m better off dead. Dastan PLUNGES the dagger into his own heart. Under the astonished stares of the guards, he crumples to his knees Blood appears on his lips. He falls dead. ON TAMINA - who stifles a cry. Tus shakes off the guard who’s just helped him put on his robe. He advances toward his brother’s body.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: My lord, if it’s a trick... Tus turns Dastan over. He’s dead, the hilt of the dagger protruding from his chest. Tus pulls it out. The blade is wet with blood. Tus examines the dagger. The unearthly, glowing white san inside its handle. For a moment we think he’s going to do something with it-- but he just lays the dagger back down the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to one of his men) Get Nizam. ON TAMINA - who pulls away from the peephole, tears strea down her face. She can’t look. The Captain tries to escort Tus out of the baths, but Tus lingers, troubled.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: He took his own life.

dialogues.speaker: CAPTAIN
dialogues.text: A coward’s way out.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: My brother was no coward.  104. He bends and picks up the dagger again. Presses the jewel TIME STOPS! The last sands fall from the dagger; a draft blows them away through the steam frozen in midair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guards close in on Dastan, just as they did before. T whirls, bewildered by deja vu: what’s happening here? As he did before, Dastan dramatically holds the dagger to own throat -- unaware that the final rewind has already happened and that the dagger is empty.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: If you won’t believe me, then our kingdom is forfeit. Our honor is forfeit. And I’m better off dead. Tus lunges at Dastan, GRABS his arm just in time to preve him from stabbing himself. The guards pull them apart.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: Let him go!! Cowed by the royal command in his voice, the guards obey.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Thanks brother.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: (wonderment ) You were dead. I saw the blood.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Blood? What blood? Perplexed, he looks down at the dagger in his hand. He nearly faints on seeing that it’s empty. Tus, overcome by emotion, clasps Dastan in a warm embrace.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: My brother. On the day we left for war, our father told me: ‘A king should listen always to the voice of reason-- but also listen to your heart.’ My heart knew you could not have done what they accused you of. I should have listened.  105. Dastan nods, still a bit shaky.

dialogues.speaker: TUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to the CAPTAIN) Send for a detachment of soldiers from my most trusted regiment. The Captain nods and exits. Tus turns back to Dastan.

dialogues.speaker: TUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come. We must find Nizam.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: One more thing, brother. There is somebody I want you to meet... Dastan turns toward the secret door as... TAMINA emerges like a vision from the steam. Tus looks at his younger brother, impressed: where’d you her?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s a long story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thunder rumbles in an ominous sky. Tus, Dastan and Tamina stride across the bridge accompanied by royal GUARDS with torches. Nizam appears at the end of the bridge with his own detachment of elite GUARDS led by Garsiv.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: Keep your swords sheathed. As the two groups come together, Nizam speaks first.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: O King!

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: Grand Vizier Nizam, you have committed treason and murder and have conspired against the house of Shahraman. (to Garsiv) Captain of the Guards, I order you to arrest this traitor.  106. Garsiv steps forward and looks Nizam in the eye.. then he turns and nods to the GUARDS surrounding Tus... Tus’s own guards grab him, Dastan and Tamina, bind their hands behind their backs and force them to their knees!

dialogues.speaker: TUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who dares lay a hand on Tus, son of Shahraman, your King!

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: O King, O Prince, I am the shadow of the reflection of your greatness. Your humble servant... As Nizam bows mockingly, Garsiv plucks Dastan’s sword fro him and raises it high...

dialogues.speaker: NOLL
dialogues.text: Garsiv brings the sword slashing down. We don’t see the impact, only the men’s reactions. Tus lies dead on the stone bridge, a spreading pool of bl beneath him in the light rain. Garsiv throws the sword down. It clatters next to Dastan.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Your sword... A CLATTERING OF HOOVES signals the arrival of the detachm of trusted soldiers with the CAPTAIN sent to fetch them.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Ho! Help! Murder!! Dastan opens his mouth to protest but the guards silence with a rain of kicks and blows. As the SOLDIERS arrive on the scene, Nizam steps forward in apparent anguish.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God help us! We arrived too late. Our King is dead-- slain by Dastan, who killed his father. Dastan tries to speak but the guards redouble their blows

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: He’s lying! Dastan is innocent!  107.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: This is the daughter of our enemy! He would have conspired with her to lead the people of this city against us! An angry murmur rises from among the detachment of soldie eager for revenge on their king’s murderer.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: (steps in) I shall take charge of questioning Dastan and his accomplice. I will find out the full extent of this conspiracy. Nizam’s guards hustle Tamina and Dastan along the bridge, drowning their protests... leaving the Captain and the so staring mournfully down at Tus’s body in the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina and Dastan are shoved into a cell and chained to t wall. The guards exit. Nizam steps forward and lifts the DAGGER from Dastan’s be His eyes glint with greed as he caresses it..

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Thank you Dastan. I’ve been looking for this. Tamina’s eyes widen in horror.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (bloody and beaten) I’m sorry Tamina...

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: You should be. You stood before the hourglass with the dagger in your hand-- the one blade capable of penetrating the glass nothing in heaven or earth can break. And the limit of your ambition was to turn back time sixty seconds? A trick for a street magician. I will turn back time sixty years.  108.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: You can’t! It’s forbidden! Nizam ignores her; continues speaking to Dastan.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Sixty years since the divine right of kingship was granted to the house of Shahraman. I was a child then, as your father was; I had the understanding of a child. Had I known what I know now, I could have acted. An accident at play. Children are fragile; they die so easily.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: On such small things empires turn. And so in my fifteenth year, when al-Ma’mun defeated al-Amin, and Babak’s head rolled in the sand at Samarra, I -- not Shahraman-- shall be seated on the throne of Nasaf. And what a king I shall be!

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Nizam, it is not for mortals to spill the Sands of Time for personal glory! You could unleash a storm that would wipe mankind off the face of the earth!!

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Superstition, girl. A scary tale told to prevent lesser men from reaching for greatness.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Greatness cannot be stolen; it must be earned. You shall never achieve it, Nizam.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: On the contrary I shall be the wisest and greatest of rulers. I will lay in stores of grain before the famine, I will build high walls when there is yet no enemy in sight. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Under my reign Persia shall rise again to be a great empire.. and I will be Shah-an-Shah, King of Kings, God among men. It’s unfortunate that you will not be born to reap this golden age. Soon, you will never even have existed. (as an afterthought) But first you will be executed. As Nizam leaves he summons the GUARDS.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Unchain the girl. I promised Garsiv he could have her to enjoy. Tamina is freed and dragged away, struggling. As Nizam leaves with her, Dastan rages.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Nizam! Nizam! NIZAM!! He ducks under one of the chains, turning himself around he’s facing the wall with his arms crossed. He repeats th maneuver, each time giving the chains another twist, unti he’s close enough to brace his feet against the wall. The PULLS until he’s screaming in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan is barely conscious. His chains haven’t budged. The distant NOISE of a door closing half-rouses him. Dastan’s lips are parched, his eyes glassy and delirious.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Tamina.. Tamina... Nizam’s guards enter and unchain him from the wall. Dasta is limp and unresisting, unaware of what’s happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prisoners stare through the bars as the guards drag Dasta his execution. The cells are packed with MEN of Alamut, sullen and fierce. Farood, slumped disconsolately in a cell with the other nomads is appalled to recognize Dastan.  110.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Ali?! They got you too? (grieved) Ali, I am sorry. We should never have come to this city! As Dastan passes, Farood grips the bars, shouts--

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell your Layla that Farood is sorry! Dastan springs into action, revealing that he’s been play possum. Using his chains as weapons, he attacks the guard More guards pour in, shouting for back up. Dastan is a one-man army, fighting six at once in the nar corridor. Unable to rid himself of his chains, he loops t over a ceiling hook and becomes a circus acrobat, spinnin and KICKING off the walls to clobber one guard after anot The prisoners rush to the bars, their shouts adding to th fearsome din. The little Gypsy Boy stares with open-mouth hero worship.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ali, you amaze me! One unlucky guard, flung against the bars, is grabbed by Farood’s daughters, who tie him in place with his own tur

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Get his keys! Nomad hands reach through the bars, frisk the guard.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Nothing! Dastan clobbers another guard, sends him Farood’s way. Th nomad women frisk the guard-- no luck. More soldiers arri making things hotter for Dastan every moment.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Try the fat one there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garsiv enters and gazes at Tamina seated on low cushions, wrists bound. Without taking his eyes off of her, he spea to the guard:  111.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: Untie her. And leave us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan fights desperately, outnumbered. Farood comes up triumphantly holding KEYS.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: I got it!

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: So open something!! Farood methodically tries one key after the next to open nomads’ cell, while Dastan battles to stay alive.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Tell me Ali, what was your crime? Dastan doesn’t have time to breathe, much less answer, as dodges a killing blow from another guard.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ah your hands are full. You will never believe how I came to be in this awful place. Dastan’s in trouble, three guards strangling him with his chains...

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I was arrested for selling an overpriced chicken at the market! Ridiculous! How can a chicken be overpriced? It is worth exactly what a man is willing to pay-- ah here it is. Farood unlocks the cell. The nomads swarm out and overwhe the guards, rescuing Dastan in the nick of time. FAROOD’S DAUGHTERS finish them off with savage gusto.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You see? I told you they were strong! Dastan, Farood and the nomads hurry down the corridor, pa cells packed with men of Alamut who rattle the bars and s in Foreign at the escaping prisoners.  112. Dastan pauses on the threshold of freedom. Looks back.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ali-- come!

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: No. These men are prisoners because of me. I ama king’s son.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: (nods understandingly) A blow on the head can cause such delusions. Fresh air and freedom are the cure. He pulls at Dastan’s arm but Dastan shakes him off. To Farood’s horror, Dastan takes the keys and unlocks the fi cell... With a ROAR, the prisoners charge out. Dastan climbs onto barrel and shouts over the commotion.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Men of Alamut, hear me! It is Dastan, prince of Nasaf, who calls to you! Farood winces-- this delusion is worse than he thought. T men of Alamut react with angry mutters that swell dangerously.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well may you hate me-- as a foreigner, as an invader. Were I in your place, my blood would cry out for vengeance for your conquered land. Farood is startled as it dawns on him. Dastan is a prince His expression transforms to one of respect and awe.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yet my land too is conquered-- from within, by a vile usurper. Help me defeat him, and I will give you back your kingdom. I swear it in the name of my father, Shahraman! Dastan pauses for effect. Farood whispers in his ear:  113.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Ali, they don’t understand your language. Dismayed, Dastan surveys his audience, realizes it’s true At that moment several of the Alamut men succeed in smash open the ARMORY. Spears and weapons are passed out. Dasta and Farood are in the center of a hostile, well-armed mob Just then, a battalion of Nasaf SOLDIERS charge in, diver the prisoners’ attention.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: (with hand gestures) Fight them! No, them! A full scale battle erupts.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Ali! Well said. Now let’s get out of here. Dastan doesn’t argue this time. Taking advantage of the confusion, they slip out of the melee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dastan, Farood and the nomads emerge through a narrow doo onto the citadel embankment, above the river. Farood breathes in the free air-- Dastan pushes him down just in time to dodge a hail of arrows. Nasaf SOLDIERS on horseback ride to intercept the Dastan and the nomad bandits throw themselves into a pitc battle. The Giant Bandit fights three soldiers at once; h plucks one from the saddle and hurls him to an icy fate i the river below. Dastan gets hold of the horse and swings into the saddle.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Farood. Hold them as long as you can.

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: (offended) Now that you're a king’s son, you are leaving us?  114.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Farood! I need to save her!

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD
dialogues.text: Your Layla?! Why didn’t you say so? Dastan smiles and prepares to depart. But suddenly he spo A new wave of NASAF SOLDIERS galloping toward them, practically licking their chops. The nomads will be desperately outnumbered... Dastan hesitates. Then he sees the expression of the Nasaf Soldiers change glee to fear as... The just-liberated Alamut men surge from the prison with terrifying ROAR! Now it’s the turn of Farood’s clan to gr as the tide suddenly turns...

dialogues.speaker: FAROOD, (CONT'D)
