dialogues.text: Go! And remember Ali-- your sword belongs to me! Dastan smiles and gallops off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guards open the door to an iron CAGE suspended with ropes pulleys over the pit. Nizam steps inside and they begin t lower him toward the hourglass...

dialogues.speaker: ON A CRY OF PAIN WE CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. COURTYARD, GARSIV’S TENT Garsiv comes reeling out, clutching his cheek where Tamin has clawed deep scratches into his face. A moment later, a pair of GUARDS drag her from the tent, pinned behind her.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: She is a demon! I’11 throw her into the pit myself!

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: He turns as Dastan rides up and leaps from his horse.  115.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You always said you’d beat me if it were a real fight instead of a contest; now’s your chance. Two more GUARDS arrive and fit arrows to their bows, read shoot Dastan. Garsiv holds up a hand.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: No. I want to kill him myself. (to Dastan) I’ve waited a long time for this moment, Dastan. And I’m going to let your Slave-Girl live just long enough to watch you die... He draws his sword.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: She’s not a Slave-Girl. (draws his sword) She’s a princess. And he charges. The two fighters fall upon one another in fury of steel-on-steel. It’s a perfect match of skill, determination and mutual hatred. Back and forth they battle, trading blows and parries. Dastan is quicker but Garsiv is the stronger. With every blow, Dastan loses a little edge. Garsiv gradually begins force Dastan backwards, toward the edge of the pit... TAMINA struggles against the two Guards holding her tight Garsiv gives Dastan a vicious kick to the stomach that se him to the ground. Garsiv smiles, moving in for the kill.

dialogues.speaker: GARSIV
dialogues.text: This is not a tournament Dastan. Your fancy tricks won’t save you now. Dastan scrambles to his feet in time to block the attack he’s on his heels, his back to the edge of the massive pi With a powerful blow, Garsiv knocks Dastan’s sword from h hand. Dastan is helpless, on the brink of the precipice. Garsiv takes one last big, two-handed swing at Dastan, ai to cut him in half. Dastan does an impossible back bend o the pit, like a limbo dancer, hanging by his toes...  116. SWOOSH! Garsiv’s sword slices air inches above Dastan’s nose! His momentum carries Garsiv around like a baseball slugger missing a strike... Dastan spins low on one pivot foot, extending the opposit leg... hitting GARSIV at the back of the knees-- TOPPLING over the cliff edge face forwards! Tamina’s GUARDS step forward with a gasp, as if they coul catch Garsiv.. MISTAKE. Tamina plucks a sword from a Guard’s belt. In a flash, sh strikes them down. The other two Guards turn to face her, warily. Dastan scrambles to his feet and starts to come to her aid--

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA
dialogues.text: Never mind me. Nizam is headed for the Hourglass! All will be lost if you don’t stop him! Tamina raises her sword, prepared to fight the two guards Dastan hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: TAMINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: a [o}

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a cranking of wheels, the CAGE comes to a halt in fr of the hourglass. Crumbling rockslides and running water create a non-stop shower of debris falling around the cha and into the abyss. Nizam pays no attention, staring in wonder at the bright sand, inches from his face. He feels the solid glass...

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: (closes his eyes) This is my destiny... He raises the dagger to strike the hourglass... Suddenly with a great RATTLING NOISE the cage shoots upwa Nizam turns--

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: No, this is your destiny! --and Dastan clobbers him with both feet, a human counterweight descending on the other end of the rope.  117. Nizam is sent sprawling... the dagger lands on the rocks, of both of their reach. Nizam gets to his feet, scowling. He draws both his sword Dastan draws his one. They square off to duel. Nizam’s two sword technique is unlike any fighting style we've seen. He wields the swords with such skill and dexterity that Dastan struggles to defend himself.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: Soon you shall be nothing more than a dream that no one will remember! Nizam presses the pace, attacking from both sides. Dastan makes a last desperate counter-attack and suddenly KNOCKS one of Nizam’s swords from his hand! A beat. New ball game. Nizam swings with his remaining sword-- Dastan blocks the blow confidently. With locked blades, Dastan presses for advantage, his youth and strength coming into play... A look of fear crosses Nizam’s face. Dastan grins.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Not so confident with only one blade? But then.. Dastan coughs. Blood trickles from his mouth. looks down: Nizam has drawn a hidden short sword with his other hand plunged it into Dastan’s side, mortally wounding him. He tricked Dastan.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: I always keep a spare. Leaving Dastan to bleed to death, Nizam retrieves the dag Again he approaches the hourglass. And AGAIN, as he is poised to strike, the CAGE flies down Tamina leaps out to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: DON'T
dialogues.text: But this time Nizam is ready. He sidesteps her attack, disarms her and grabs her by the throat. He lifts her bod and holds her over the abyss...  118.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: (looks at her) A very pretty face, indeed. Perhaps when you are born thirty years from now I will do you the honor of making you one of my wives... Dastan lifts his head and sees Nizam dangling Tamina.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: «but right now you are a nuisance. And with that he releases her!

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Noll! Dastan hears her screams echo into the distance as she fa With every last bit of his strength, he pulls himself up. Nizam climbs the steps to the hourglass. He takes out the dagger and raises it high... He strikes! Just then... DASTAN lunges into frame, grabbing his hand to stop him. late. Nizam plunges the dagger into the glass blade-first

dialogues.speaker: TIME STOPS
dialogues.text: Falling rocks and water frozen in midair, Dastan and Niza grappling like two statues, faces contorted-- In the silence resounds a booming NOISE, like ice crackin The CRACK spreads across the surface of the hourglass fro the point where the dagger penetrated it. And-- SAND starts to pour from the crack. TIME RUNS BACKWARD! Rocks and water fly back upward, Tami is returned and ascends again-- the REWIND ACCELERATING a the crack in the hourglass widens, the glowing white SAND pouring out at an ever-faster rate-- DASTAN and NIZAM Are untouched in the eye of the storm, in the blinding LI of the hourglass. Both of their hands are on the dagger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becomes a blur through which we catch quick glimpses of action: Dastan fighting Garsiv, Tus’s murder on the bridg Tamina and Dastan’s kiss... All the while, SAND keeps pouring from the hourglass-- no a torrent, swept by the gathering wind into a blinding SANDSTORM that threatens to grow out of control and becom apocalyptic... DASTAN, as if stunned by a concussion, shakes himself awa to realize he’s there with Nizam, in the bright ROARING center of the sandstorm. Nizam, in ecstasy, holds the dagger in place -- SAND pour out of what is no longer the hourglass, but a CRACK in th very surface of the universe. The wind sweeps up the sand it pours out, adding to the storm. Savagely, Nizam pries Dastan’s hand from the dagger. Dast hangs on, too weak to fight back. The wind rips at him; i he lets go, he’ll be sucked into oblivion. Nizam gives Dastan a sharp elbow. Dastan loses his grip a is nearly swept off by the wind-- but he keeps a hold. Dastan looks down, sees blood soaking his tunic. His life ebbing away; he can’t hang on much longer. Then, out of the maelstrom of events REWINDING all around them, an IMPLOSION of light in the dawn sky attracts Dast attention. Hazily looking up, he sees a flaming arrow arc backward through the sky: the opening battle. Dastan summons the last of his strength and will. Bearing down on Nizam’s arm, he PULLS OUT THE DAGGER. In that instant, the crack in the hourglass repairs itsel Before Nizam can recover, the SANDSTORM sweeps both him a Dastan into the void... For a few moments, SAND is all we see and hear. Then, lit by little, the SANDSTORM starts to clear... Dastan looks around. At first he can’t tell where he is. The sand is everywhere. In his teeth, in his hair. He searches himself for the dagger. He doesn’t have it. Gradually he starts to make out other figures nearby. Persian soldiers, shouting in the wind. Horses whinny.. With a shock of dread, Dastan realizes--—  120.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He’s too late. We're reliving the opening battle. The Persian army is already charging toward Alamut-- repeatin the mistake with the inexorability of a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: No! Nol!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lashed by sand and wind, the Alamut Sentry grabs a stick beats the gong in warning as he did the first time. INT. TAMINA’S BEDROOM - SUNRISE The GONG awakens Tamina. Sand is blowing into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tus raises his sword and lets out a WAR CRY, exactly repeating his action of the opening sequence. From the ra rises a blood-curdling noise as thousands of voices join Only one thing has changed: Dastan. Outwardly he’s the same, but his faces shows a new maturity and resolve. He knows what he must do. Dastan looks to the ramparts and sees the flaming arrow launched into the air.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: No. He rides toward Tus, shouting--

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tus! Call off the attack! The arrow explodes into a shower of brilliant fireworks, illuminating the scene like a lightning flash. Nizam, on horseback, suddenly blocks Dastan’s way. He strikes, nearly knocking Dastan off his horse. Dastan tries to ride past but Nizam maneuvers to block hi only these two men know what’s at stake.  121. They clash on horseback-- Dastan parries Nizam’s double- bladed attack. The duel begins... while around them the A archers begin to pick off Persian soldiers, creating chao before. Tus, in the vanguard, looks around and sees-- Dastan and Nizam dueling. His face contorts with anger.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: Dastan. He does not know why his hot-headed younger brother is fighting with Nizam, but he knows Dastan’s immaturity is jeopardizing the battle. Enraged, Tus rides back...

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM AND DASTAN,
dialogues.text: fight furiously. As before, Dastan’s on the defensive. A growing circle of onlookers gathers, uncertain whether to intervene.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: (to the men) Traitor! The King’s son would betray us to our enemy!

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: He’s lying! The battlefield around them is chaos-- soldiers felled by arrows, catapults erupting in FLAMES. Nizam’s personal guards ride toward the dueling pair. A handful of common footsoldiers block their way with spear

dialogues.speaker: BRUTISH SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Oh no. This stays a fair fight. In a bold and desperate move, Dastan stands up on his sad and launches himself at Nizam, knocking him off his horse They roll together on the ground. Nizam lands on his back Dastan straddling him, sword raised-- Tus arrives on horseback, forcing his way through the cir

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: Hold! HOLD!! Dastan freezes, inches from killing Nizam. He can’t disob his brother.  122. Nizam’s right hand creeps along the ground, toward his sw that landed inches away...

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Tus, call off the attack! It’s a trick. Nizam lied to us.

dialogues.speaker: NIZAM
dialogues.text: We can win. Dastan is a traitor.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: Dastan, put down your sword.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: No. Tus can’t believe Dastan’s insubordination.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: We have no reason to attack Alamut. Our victory will bring us disaster. Menacingly, Tus draws his own sword.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: We are at war-- and I command. Put down your sword. The threat is clear. Still Dastan hesitates. Nizam sees his chance. His right hand closes on his sword hilt; he swings upward at Dastan’s neck-- Dastan sees the sword coming, BLOCKS it-- As Nizam expected: he pulls out the hidden short sword wi his OTHER hand and strikes toward Dastan’s exposed torso- But this time Dastan knows it’s coming: with blinding spe Dastan turns, BLOCKS the second blow, and drives his swor like a stake into Nizam’s heart. The men watching are stunned. Nizam can’t believe it eith He coughs. And then he’s dead. Dastan hurls his sword away from him; it sticks quivering the frozen ground. He stands to face Tus.  123.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: Kill me if you must. But call off the attack-- for Alamut is blameless. Dastan advances, making it easier for Tus to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tus, do you remember Father’s words to you on a the day we left for war? ‘A king must listen always to the voice of reason.’

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: (mystified) How could...?

dialogues.speaker: DASTAN
dialogues.text: ‘..but also listen to your heart.’ Tus stares at him. Dastan meets his gaze, calmly resolute This is not the younger brother he knew. It’s as if Dasta matured overnight. Tus turns and shouts--

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: Halt! Retreat! His orders echo through the ranks, repeated by the comman at every level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Alamut PRIEST takes the dagger from an ornate box and about to entrust it to the Fearsome armored Warrior when- Alamut soldiers come running bearing news, shouting. The Priest looks out over a parapet. Below, the great wave of men moving toward the castle has stopped. The Persian army is turning around. The Priest looks at the dagger in his hand... utters a si PRAYER of thanks, and replaces it in its box.  124.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tamina, in her nightgown, watches through a loophole as t army vanishes into the mist. On her young face is a vague sense of the danger she’s just escaped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Persian delegation, Tus, the twins, Dastan and forty soldiers, marches past Alamut soldiers standing at attent The King of Alamut and his court awaits them on a dais.

dialogues.speaker: TUS
dialogues.text: (bows formally) From my father, King Shahraman. An ATTENDANT steps forward bearing a chest; an INTERPRETE repeats Tus’s words in Foreign. The King responds in kind As the formalities drag on, Dastan slips away from his brothers. As he edges over towards the temple, he tries t catch the eye of... TAMINA, resplendent in full regalia, standing amongst a g of Alamut NOBLEWOMEN. She notices the young Prince lookin at her.. he smiles! She blushes and turns away, giggling with one of her LADIES-IN-WAITING. But she glances back anyway... On the dais, Tus and the King of Alamut embrace in ritual friendship. A murmur runs through the crowd. The Twins lean together for a private aside.

dialogues.speaker: FARHAD
dialogues.text: I hope he doesn’t make us marry his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: FARHAN
dialogues.text: Make you marry her.

dialogues.speaker: FARHAD
dialogues.text: No, you. The sound of a SPLASH and a following commotion turns the heads. The Twins are greatly amused to see that: DASTAN has somehow fallen into the SACRED FOUNTAIN. He’s being helped out by an irritated Alamut Priest.  125. Tus shakes his head in embarrassment: his younger brother at it again. The King waves it off indulgently. Dastan emerges, dripping wet, with a big grin on his face He looks right at-- TAMINA, unable to suppress a smile of amusement and curiosity. Dastan gets a glimmer in his eyes. He winks at her, as if the two of them share a secret... FADE OUT.
